   32: %% 1224           0 :                 outc(ubuf[i]);
   33: %% 1225             :             }

   38: -export([all/0, suite/0, groups/0, init_per_suite/1, end_per_suite/1,
   39:          init_per_group/2, end_per_group/2,
   40:          init_per_testcase/2, end_per_testcase/2,
   41: 	 get_columns_and_rows/1, exit_initial/1, job_control_local/1,
   42: 	 job_control_remote/1,stop_during_init/1,wrap/1,
   43:          shell_history/1, shell_history_resize/1, shell_history_eaccess/1,
   44:          shell_history_repair/1, shell_history_repair_corrupt/1,
   45:          shell_history_corrupt/1,
   46:          shell_history_custom/1, shell_history_custom_errors/1,
   47: 	 job_control_remote_noshell/1,ctrl_keys/1,
   48:          get_columns_and_rows_escript/1,
   49:          shell_navigation/1, shell_multiline_navigation/1, shell_multiline_prompt/1,
   50:          shell_xnfix/1, shell_delete/1,
   51:          shell_transpose/1, shell_search/1, shell_insert/1,
   52:          shell_update_window/1, shell_small_window_multiline_navigation/1, shell_huge_input/1,

   68: -export([test_invalid_keymap/1, test_valid_keymap/1]).
   69: %% Exports for custom shell history module
   70: -export([load/0, add/1]).
   71: %% For custom prompt testing
   72: -export([prompt/1]).
   73: -record(tmux, {peer, node, name, orig_location }).
   74: suite() ->
   75:     [{ct_hooks,[ts_install_cth]},
   76:      {timetrap,{minutes,3}}].
   77: 
   78: all() ->
   79:     [{group, to_erl},
   80:      {group, tty}].
   81: 
   82: groups() ->
   83:     [{to_erl,[],
   84:       [get_columns_and_rows_escript,get_columns_and_rows,
   85:        exit_initial, job_control_local,
   86:        job_control_remote, job_control_remote_noshell,
   87:        ctrl_keys, stop_during_init, wrap,
   88:        shell_invalid_ansi,
   89:        {group, shell_history},
   90:        {group, remsh}]},
   91:      {shell_history, [],
   92:       [shell_history,
   93:        shell_history_resize,
   94:        shell_history_eaccess,
   95:        shell_history_repair,
   96:        shell_history_repair_corrupt,
   97:        shell_history_corrupt,
   98:        {group, sh_custom}
   99:       ]},
  100:      {sh_custom, [],
  101:       [shell_history_custom,
  102:        shell_history_custom_errors]},
  103:      {remsh, [],
  104:       [remsh_basic,
  105:        remsh_error,
  106:        remsh_longnames,
  107:        remsh_no_epmd,
  108:        remsh_expand_compatibility_25,
  109:        remsh_expand_compatibility_later_version]},
  110:      {tty,[],
  111:       [{group,tty_unicode},
  112:        {group,tty_latin1},
  113:        test_invalid_keymap, test_valid_keymap,
  114:        shell_suspend,
  115:        shell_full_queue,
  116:        external_editor,
  117:        external_editor_visual,
  118:        shell_ignore_pager_commands
  119:       ]},
  120:      {tty_unicode,[parallel],
  121:       [{group,tty_tests},
  122:        shell_invalid_unicode,
  123:        external_editor_unicode

  125:        %% shell_unicode_wrap,
  126:        %% shell_delete_unicode_wrap,
  127:        %% shell_delete_unicode_not_at_cursor_wrap,
  128:        %% shell_update_window_unicode_wrap
  129:       ]},
  130:      {tty_latin1,[],[{group,tty_tests}]},
  131:      {tty_tests, [parallel],
  132:       [shell_navigation, shell_multiline_navigation, shell_multiline_prompt,
  133:        shell_xnfix, shell_delete, shell_format,
  134:        shell_transpose, shell_search, shell_insert,

  142:     ].
  143: 
  144: init_per_suite(Config) ->
  145:     Term = os:getenv("TERM", "dumb"),
  146:     os:putenv("TERM", "vt100"),
  147:     [{term,Term}|Config].
  148: 
  149: end_per_suite(Config) ->
  150:     Term = proplists:get_value(term,Config),
  151:     os:putenv("TERM",Term),
  152:     ok.
  153: 
  154: init_per_group(to_erl, Config) ->
  155:     case rtnode:get_progs() of
  156:         {error, Error} ->
  157:             {skip, Error};
  158:         _ ->
  159:             DefShell = rtnode:get_default_shell(),
  160:             [{default_shell,DefShell}|Config]
  161:     end;
  162: init_per_group(remsh, Config) ->
  163:     case proplists:get_value(default_shell, Config) of
  164:         old -> {skip, "Not supported in old shell"};
  165:         new -> Config
  166:     end;
  167: init_per_group(shell_history, Config) ->
  168:     case proplists:get_value(default_shell, Config) of
  169:         old -> {skip, "Not supported in old shell"};
  170:         new -> Config
  171:     end;
  172: init_per_group(tty, Config) ->
  173:     case string:split(tmux("-V")," ") of
  174:         ["tmux",[Num,$.|_]] when Num >= $3, Num =< $9 ->
  175:             tmux("kill-session"),
  176:             "" = tmux("-u new-session -x 50 -y 60 -d"),
  177:             ["" = tmux(["set-environment '",Name,"' '",Value,"'"])
  178:              || {Name,Value} <- os:env()],
  179:             Config;
  180:         ["tmux", Vsn] ->
  181:             {skip, "invalid tmux version " ++ Vsn ++ ". Need vsn 3 or later"};
  182:         Error ->
  183:             {skip, "tmux not installed " ++ Error}
  184:     end;
  185: init_per_group(Group, Config) when Group =:= tty_unicode;
  186:                                    Group =:= tty_latin1 ->
  187:     [Lang,_] =
  188:         string:split(
  189:           os:getenv("LC_ALL",
  190:                     os:getenv("LC_CTYPE",
  191:                               os:getenv("LANG","en_US.UTF-8"))),"."),
  192:     case Group of
  193:         tty_unicode ->
  194:             [{encoding, unicode},{env,[{"LC_ALL",Lang++".UTF-8"}]}|Config];
  195:         tty_latin1 ->
  196:             % [{encoding, latin1},{env,[{"LC_ALL",Lang++".ISO-8859-1"}]}|Config],
  197:             {skip, "latin1 tests not implemented yet"}
  198:     end;
  199: init_per_group(sh_custom, Config) ->
  200:     %% Ensure that ERL_AFLAGS will not override the value of the shell_history variable.
  201:     {ok, Peer, Node} = ?CT_PEER(["-noshell","-kernel","shell_history","not_overridden"]),
  202:     try erpc:call(Node, application, get_env, [kernel, shell_history], rtnode:timeout(normal)) of
  203:         {ok, not_overridden} ->
  204:             Config;
  205:         _ ->
  206:             SkipText = "shell_history variable is overridden (probably by ERL_AFLAGS)",
  207:             {skip, SkipText}
  208:     catch
  209:         C:R:Stk ->
  210:             io:format("~p\n~p\n~p\n", [C,R,Stk]),
  211:             {skip, "Unexpected error"}
  212:     after
  213:         peer:stop(Peer)
  214:     end;
  215: init_per_group(_GroupName, Config) ->
  216:     Config.
  217: 
  218: end_per_group(tty, _Config) ->
  219:     Windows = string:split(tmux("list-windows"), "\n", all),
  220:     lists:foreach(
  221:       fun(W) ->
  222:               case string:split(W, " ", all) of
  223:                   ["0:" | _] -> ok;
  224:                   [No, _Name | _] ->
  225:                       "" = os:cmd(["tmux select-window -t ", string:split(No,":")]),
  226:                       ct:log("~ts~n~ts",[W, os:cmd(lists:concat(["tmux capture-pane -p -e"]))])
  227:               end
  228:       end, Windows),
  229: %    "" = os:cmd("tmux kill-session")
  230:     ok;
  231: end_per_group(_GroupName, Config) ->
  232:     Config.
  233: 
  234: init_per_testcase(Func, Config) ->
  235:     Path = [Func,
  236:             [proplists:get_value(name,P) ||
  237:                 P <- [proplists:get_value(tc_group_properties,Config,[])] ++
  238:                     proplists:get_value(tc_group_path,Config,[])]],
  239:     [{tc_path, lists:concat(lists:join("-",lists:flatten(Path)))} | Config].
  240: 
  241: end_per_testcase(_Case, Config) ->
  242:     GroupProperties = proplists:get_value(tc_group_properties, Config),
  243:     case (GroupProperties =/= false) andalso proplists:get_value(parallel, GroupProperties, false) of
  244:         true -> ok;
  245:         false ->
  246:             %% Terminate any connected nodes. They may disturb test cases that follow.
  247:             lists:foreach(fun(Node) ->
  248:                                   catch erpc:call(Node, erlang, halt, [])
  249:                           end, nodes()),
  250:             ok
  251:     end.
  252: 
  253: %%-define(DEBUG,1).
  254: -ifdef(DEBUG).
  255: -define(dbg(Data),ct:pal("~p",[Data])).
  256: -else.
  257: -define(dbg(Data),noop).
  258: -endif.
  259: 
  260: string_to_term(Str) ->
  261:     {ok,Tokens,_EndLine} = erl_scan:string(Str ++ "."),
  262:     {ok,AbsForm} = erl_parse:parse_exprs(Tokens),
  263:     {value,Value,_Bs} = erl_eval:exprs(AbsForm, erl_eval:new_bindings()),
  264:     Value.
  265: 
  266: run_unbuffer_escript(Rows, Columns, EScript, NoTermStdIn, NoTermStdOut) ->
  267:     DataDir = filename:join(filename:dirname(code:which(?MODULE)), "interactive_shell_SUITE_data"),
  268:     TmpFile = filename:join(DataDir, "tmp"),
  269:     ok = file:write_file(TmpFile, <<>>),
  270:     CommandModifier =
  271:         case {NoTermStdIn, NoTermStdOut} of
  272:             {false, false} -> "";
  273:             {true, false} -> io_lib:format(" < ~s", [TmpFile]);
  274:             {false, true} -> io_lib:format(" > ~s ; cat ~s", [TmpFile, TmpFile]);
  275:             {true, true} -> io_lib:format(" > ~s < ~s ; cat ~s", [TmpFile, TmpFile, TmpFile])
  276:         end,
  277:     Command = io_lib:format("unbuffer -p bash -c \"stty rows ~p; stty columns ~p; escript ~s ~s\"",
  278:                             [Rows, Columns, EScript, CommandModifier]),
  279:     %% io:format("Command: ~s ~n", [Command]),
  280:     Out = os:cmd(Command),
  281:     %% io:format("Out: ~p ~n", [Out]),
  282:     string_to_term(Out).
  283: 
  284: get_columns_and_rows_escript(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  285:     ExpectUnbufferInstalled =
  286:         try
  287:             "79" = string:trim(os:cmd("unbuffer -p bash -c \"stty columns 79 ; tput cols\"")),
  288:             true
  289:         catch
  290:             _:_ -> false
  291:         end,
  292:     case ExpectUnbufferInstalled of
  293:         false ->
  294:             {skip,
  295:              "The unbuffer tool (https://core.tcl-lang.org/expect/index) does not seem to be installed.~n"
  296:              "On Ubuntu/Debian: \"sudo apt-get install expect\""};
  297:         true ->
  298:             DataDir = filename:join(filename:dirname(code:which(?MODULE)), "interactive_shell_SUITE_data"),
  299:             IoColumnsErl = filename:join(DataDir, "io_columns.erl"),
  300:             IoRowsErl = filename:join(DataDir, "io_rows.erl"),
  301:             [
  302:              begin
  303:                  {ok, 42} = run_unbuffer_escript(99, 42, IoColumnsErl, NoTermStdIn, NoTermStdOut),
  304:                  {ok, 99} = run_unbuffer_escript(99, 42, IoRowsErl, NoTermStdIn, NoTermStdOut)
  305:              end
  306:              ||
  307:                 {NoTermStdIn, NoTermStdOut} <- [{false, false}, {true, false}, {false, true}]
  308:             ],
  309:             {error,enotsup} = run_unbuffer_escript(99, 42, IoRowsErl, true, true),
  310:             {error,enotsup} = run_unbuffer_escript(99, 42, IoColumnsErl, true, true),
  311:             ok
  312:     end.
  313: 
  314: %% Test that the shell can access columns and rows.
  315: get_columns_and_rows(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  316:     case proplists:get_value(default_shell, Config) of
  317: 	old ->
  318:             test_columns_and_rows(old, []);
  319: 	new ->
  320:             test_columns_and_rows(old, ["-oldshell"]),
  321:             test_columns_and_rows(new, [])
  322:     end,
  323:     ok.
  324: 
  325: test_columns_and_rows(old, Args) ->
  326:     rtnode:run(
  327:       [{putline, ""},
  328:        {putline, "2."},
  329:        {expect, "2\r\n"},
  330:        {putline, "io:columns()."},
  331:        {expect, "{error,enotsup}\r\n"},
  332:        {putline, "io:rows()."},
  333:        {expect, "{error,enotsup}\r\n"}
  334:       ], [], [], Args),
  335: 
  336:     rtnode:run(
  337:       [{putline, ""},
  338:        {putline, "2."},
  339:        {expect, "2\r\n"},
  340:        {putline, "io:columns()."},
  341:        {expect, "{ok,90}\r\n"},
  342:        {putline,"io:rows()."},
  343:        {expect, "{ok,40}\r\n"}],
  344:       [],
  345:       "stty rows 40; stty columns 90; ",
  346:       Args);
  347: test_columns_and_rows(new, _Args) ->
  348:     rtnode:run(
  349:       [{putline, ""},
  350:        {expect, "1> $"},
  351:        {putline, "2."},
  352:        {expect, "\r\n2\r\n"},
  353:        {expect, "> $"},
  354:        {putline, "io:columns()."},
  355:        {expect, "{ok,80}\r\n"},
  356:        {expect, "> $"},
  357:        {putline, "io:rows()."},
  358:        {expect, "\r\n{ok,24}\r\n"}
  359:       ]),
  360: 
  361:     rtnode:run(
  362:       [{putline, ""},
  363:        {expect, "1> $"},
  364:        {putline, "2."},
  365:        {expect,  "\r\n2\r\n"},
  366:        {expect, "> $"},
  367:        {putline, "io:columns()."},
  368:        {expect, "\r\n{ok,90}\r\n"},
  369:        {expect, "> $"},
  370:        {putline, "io:rows()."},
  371:        {expect, "\r\n{ok,40}\r\n"}],
  372:       [],
  373:       "stty rows 40; stty columns 90; ").
  374: 
  375: shell_navigation(Config) ->
  376: 
  377:     Term = start_tty(Config),
  378: 
  379:     try
  380:         [begin
  381:              send_tty(Term,"{aaa,'b"++U++"b',ccc}"),
  382:              check_location(Term, {0, 0}), %% Check that cursor jump backward
  383:              check_content(Term, "{aaa,'b"++U++"b',ccc}$"),
  384:              timer:sleep(1000), %% Wait for cursor to jump back
  385:              check_location(Term, {0, width("{aaa,'b"++U++"b',ccc}")}),
  386:              send_tty(Term,"Home"),
  387:              check_location(Term, {0, 0}),
  388:              send_tty(Term,"End"),
  389:              check_location(Term, {0, width("{aaa,'b"++U++"b',ccc}")}),
  390:              send_tty(Term,"Left"),
  391:              check_location(Term, {0, width("{aaa,'b"++U++"b',ccc")}),
  392:              send_tty(Term,"C-Left"),
  393:              check_location(Term, {0, width("{aaa,'b"++U++"b',")}),
  394:              send_tty(Term,"C-Left"),
  395:              check_location(Term, {0, width("{aaa,")}),
  396:              send_tty(Term,"C-Right"),
  397:              check_location(Term, {0, width("{aaa,'b"++U++"b'")}),
  398:              send_tty(Term,"C-Left"),
  399:              check_location(Term, {0, width("{aaa,")}),
  400:              send_tty(Term,"C-Left"),
  401:              check_location(Term, {0, width("{")}),
  402:              send_tty(Term,"C-Left"),
  403:              check_location(Term, {0, 0}),
  404:              send_tty(Term,"C-E"),
  405:              check_location(Term, {0, width("{aaa,'b"++U++"b',ccc}")}),
  406:              send_tty(Term,"C-H"),
  407:              check_location(Term, {0, width("{aaa,'b"++U++"b',ccc")}),
  408:              send_tty(Term,"C-A"),
  409:              check_location(Term, {0, 0}),
  410:              send_tty(Term,"Enter")
  411:          end || U <- hard_unicode()],
  412:         ok
  413:     after
  414:         stop_tty(Term)
  415:     end.
  416: shell_multiline_navigation(Config) ->
  417:     Term = start_tty(Config),
  418: 
  419:     try
  420:         [begin
  421:              check_location(Term, {0, 0}),
  422:              send_tty(Term,"{aaa,"),
  423:              check_location(Term, {0,width("{aaa,")}),
  424:              send_tty(Term,"\n'b"++U++"b',"),
  425:              check_location(Term, {0, width("'b"++U++"b',")}),
  426:              send_tty(Term,"\nccc}"),
  427:              check_location(Term, {-2, 0}), %% Check that cursor jump backward (blink)
  428:              timer:sleep(1000), %% Wait for cursor to jump back
  429:              check_location(Term, {0, width("ccc}")}),
  430:              send_tty(Term,"Home"),
  431:              check_location(Term, {0, 0}),
  432:              send_tty(Term,"End"),
  433:              check_location(Term, {0, width("ccc}")}),
  434:              send_tty(Term,"Left"),
  435:              check_location(Term, {0, width("ccc")}),
  436:              send_tty(Term,"C-Left"),
  437:              check_location(Term, {0, 0}),
  438:              send_tty(Term,"C-Left"),
  439:              check_location(Term, {-1, width("'b"++U++"b',")}),
  440:              send_tty(Term,"C-Left"),
  441:              check_location(Term, {-1, 0}),
  442:              %send_tty(Term,"C-Left"),
  443:              %check_location(Term, {-1, 0}),
  444:              %send_tty(Term,"C-Right"),
  445:              %check_location(Term, {-1, 1}),
  446:              send_tty(Term,"C-Right"),
  447:              check_location(Term, {-1, width("'b"++U++"b'")}),
  448:              send_tty(Term,"C-Up"),
  449:              check_location(Term, {-2, width("{aaa,")}),
  450:              send_tty(Term,"C-Down"),
  451:              send_tty(Term,"C-Down"),
  452:              check_location(Term, {0, width("ccc}")}),
  453:              send_tty(Term,"Left"),
  454:              send_tty(Term,"C-Up"),
  455:              check_location(Term, {-1, width("'b"++U)}),
  456:              send_tty(Term,"M-<"),
  457:              check_location(Term, {-2, 0}),
  458:              send_tty(Term,"M->"),
  459:              send_tty(Term,"Left"),
  460:              check_location(Term, {0,width("ccc")}),
  461:              send_tty(Term,"Enter"),
  462:              send_tty(Term,"Right"),
  463:              check_location(Term, {0,0}),
  464:              send_tty(Term,"C-h"), % Backspace
  465:              check_location(Term, {-1,width("ccc}")}),
  466:              send_tty(Term, "C-Up"),
  467:              send_tty(Term, "End"),
  468:              send_tty(Term,"Left"),
  469:              send_tty(Term,"M-Enter"),
  470:              check_content(Term, ".. ,"),
  471:              check_location(Term, {-1,0}),
  472:              send_tty(Term,"M-c"),
  473:              check_location(Term, {-3,0}),
  474:              send_tty(Term,"{'"++U++"',\n\n\nworks}.\n")
  475:             end || U <- hard_unicode()],
  476:         ok
  477:     after
  478:         stop_tty(Term)
  479:     end.
  480: 
  481: shell_format(Config) ->
  482:     Term1 = start_tty([{args,["-stdlib","format_shell_func","{shell,erl_pp_format_func}"]}|Config]),
  483:     DataDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
  484:     EmacsFormat = "\""++DataDir ++ "emacs-format-file\"\n",
  485:     try
  486:         send_tty(Term1,"fun(X) ->\n  X\nend.\n"),
  487:         send_tty(Term1,"Up"),
  488:         %% Note, erl_pp puts 7 spaces before X
  489:         check_content(Term1, "fun\\(X\\) ->\\s*..        X\\s*.. end."),
  490:         send_tty(Term1, "Down"),
  491:         tmux(["resize-window -t ",tty_name(Term1)," -x ",200]),
  492:         timer:sleep(1000),
  493:         send_stdin(Term1, "shell:format_shell_func(\"emacs -batch \${file} -l \"\n"),
  494:         send_stdin(Term1, EmacsFormat),
  495:         send_stdin(Term1, "\" -f emacs-format-function\").\n"),
  496:         check_content(Term1, "{shell,erl_pp_format_func}"),
  497:         send_tty(Term1, "Up"),
  498:         send_tty(Term1, "Up"),
  499:         send_tty(Term1, "\n"),
  500:         timer:sleep(1000),
  501:         send_tty(Term1, "Up"),
  502:         %% Note, emacs-format puts 8 spaces before X
  503:         check_content(Term1, "fun\\(X\\) ->\\s*..         X\\s*.. end."),
  504:         send_tty(Term1, "Down"),
  505:         send_stdin(Term1, "shell:format_shell_func({bad,format}).\n"),
  506:         send_tty(Term1, "Up"),
  507:         send_tty(Term1, "Up"),
  508:         send_tty(Term1, "\n"),
  509:         timer:sleep(1000),
  510:         check_content(Term1, "\\Q* Bad format function: {bad,format}\\E"),
  511:         send_tty(Term1, "Up"),
  512:         %% No modifications should be made, when default format function is used
  513:         check_content(Term1, "fun\\(X\\) ->\\s*..         X\\s*.. end."),
  514:         ok
  515:     after
  516:         stop_tty(Term1)
  517:     end.
  518: 
  519: shell_multiline_prompt(Config) ->
  520:     Term1 = start_tty([{args,["-stdlib","shell_multiline_prompt","{shell,inverted_space_prompt}"]}|Config]),
  521:     Term2 = start_tty([{args,["-stdlib","shell_multiline_prompt","\"...> \""]}|Config]),
  522:     Term3 = start_tty([{args,["-stdlib","shell_multiline_prompt","edlin"]}|Config]),
  523:     Term4 = start_tty(Config),
  524:     try
  525:         check_location(Term1, {0, 0}),
  526:         send_tty(Term1,"\na"),
  527:         check_location(Term1, {0, 1}),
  528:         check_content(Term1, "   a"),
  529:         ok
  530:     after
  531:         stop_tty(Term1)
  532:     end,
  533:     try
  534:         check_location(Term2, {0, 0}),
  535:         send_tty(Term2,"\na"),
  536:         check_location(Term2, {0, 1}),
  537:         check_content(Term2, "...> a"),
  538:         ok
  539:     after
  540:         stop_tty(Term2)
  541:     end,
  542:     try
  543:         send_tty(Term3,"\na"),
  544:         check_location(Term3, {0, 1}),
  545:         check_content(Term3, ".. a"),
  546:         ok
  547:     after
  548:         stop_tty(Term3)
  549:     end,
  550:     try
  551:         send_tty(Term4, "shell:multiline_prompt_func(\"-> \").\n"),
  552:         check_content(Term4, "default"),
  553:         send_tty(Term4, "a\nb"),
  554:         check_content(Term4, "-> b"),
  555:         ok
  556:     after
  557:         stop_tty(Term4)
  558:     end.
  559: 
  560: shell_clear(Config) ->
  561: 
  562:     Term = start_tty(Config),
  563:     {Rows, _Cols} = get_window_size(Term),
  564: 
  565:     try
  566:         send_tty(Term,"foobar."),
  567:         send_tty(Term,"Enter"),
  568:         check_content(Term, "foobar"),
  569:         check_location(Term, {0, 0}),
  570:         send_tty(Term,"bazbat"),
  571:         check_location(Term, {0, 6}),
  572:         send_tty(Term,"C-L"),
  573:         check_location(Term, {-Rows+1, 6}),
  574:         check_content(Term, "bazbat")
  575:     after
  576:         stop_tty(Term)
  577:     end.
  578: 
  579: shell_xnfix(Config) ->
  580: 
  581:     Term = start_tty(Config),
  582: 
  583:     {_Rows, Cols} = get_window_size(Term),
  584:     {_Row, Col} = get_location(Term),
  585: 
  586:     As = lists:duplicate(Cols - Col - 1,"a"),
  587: 
  588:     try
  589:         [begin
  590:              check_location(Term, {0, 0}),
  591:              send_tty(Term,As),
  592:              check_content(Term,[As,$$]),
  593:              check_location(Term, {0, Cols - Col - 1}),
  594:              send_tty(Term,"a"),
  595:              check_location(Term, {0, -Col}),
  596:              send_tty(Term,"aaa"),
  597:              check_location(Term, {0, -Col + 3}),
  598:              [send_tty(Term,"Left") || _ <- lists:seq(1,3 + width(U))],
  599:              send_tty(Term,U),
  600:              %% a{Cols-1}U\naaaaa
  601:              check_content(Term,[lists:duplicate(Cols - Col - 1 - width(U),$a),
  602:                                  U,"\n",lists:duplicate(3+width(U), $a),"$"]),
  603:              check_location(Term, {0, -Col}),
  604:              send_tty(Term,"Left"),
  605:              send_tty(Term,U),
  606:              %% a{Cols-1}U\nUaaaaa
  607:              check_content(Term,[lists:duplicate(Cols - Col - 1 - width(U),$a),
  608:                                  U,"\n",U,lists:duplicate(3+width(U), $a),"$"]),
  609:              check_location(Term, {0, -Col}),
  610:              %% send_tty(Term,"Left"),
  611:              %% send_tty(Term,"BSpace"),
  612:              %% a{Cols-2}U\nUaaaaa
  613:              %% check_content(Term,[lists:duplicate(Cols - Col - 2 - width(U),$a),
  614:              %%                     U,"\n",U,lists:duplicate(3+width(U), $a),"$"]),
  615:              %% send_tty(Term,"BSpace"),
  616:              %% check_content(Term,[lists:duplicate(Cols - Col - 1 - width(U),$a),
  617:              %%                     U,U,"\n",lists:duplicate(3+width(U), $a),"$"]),
  618:              %% send_tty(Term,"aa"),
  619:              %% check_content(Term,[lists:duplicate(Cols - Col - 2 - width(U),$a),
  620:              %%                     U,"a\n",U,lists:duplicate(3+width(U), $a),"$"]),
  621:              %% check_location(Term, {0, -Col}),
  622:              send_tty(Term,"C-K"),
  623:              check_location(Term, {0, -Col}),
  624:              send_tty(Term,"C-A"),
  625:              check_location(Term, {-1, 0}),
  626:              send_tty(Term,"C-E"),
  627:              check_location(Term, {0, -Col}),
  628:              send_tty(Term,"Enter"),
  629:              ok
  630:          end || U <- hard_unicode()]
  631:     after
  632:         stop_tty(Term)
  633:     end.
  634: 
  635: 
  636: %% Characters that are larger than 2 wide need special handling when they
  637: %% are at the end of the current line.
  638: shell_unicode_wrap(Config) ->
  639: 
  640:     Term = start_tty(Config),
  641: 
  642:     {_Rows, Cols} = get_window_size(Term),
  643:     {_Row, Col} = get_location(Term),
  644: 
  645:     try
  646:         [begin
  647:              FirstLine = [U,lists:duplicate(Cols - Col - width(U)*2 + 1,"a")],
  648:              OtherLineA = [U,lists:duplicate(Cols - width(U) * 2+1,"a")],
  649:              OtherLineB = [U,lists:duplicate(Cols - width(U) * 2+1,"b")],
  650:              OtherLineC = [U,lists:duplicate(Cols - width(U) * 2+1,"c")],
  651:              OtherLineD = [U,lists:duplicate(Cols - width(U) * 2+1,"d")],
  652:              send_tty(Term,FirstLine),
  653:              check_content(Term, [FirstLine,$$]),
  654:              check_location(Term, {0, Cols - Col - width(U)+1}),
  655: 
  656:              send_tty(Term,OtherLineA),
  657:              check_content(Term, [OtherLineA,$$]),
  658:              check_location(Term, {0, Cols - Col - width(U)+1}),
  659: 
  660:              send_tty(Term,OtherLineB),
  661:              check_content(Term, [OtherLineB,$$]),
  662:              check_location(Term, {0, Cols - Col - width(U)+1}),
  663: 
  664:              send_tty(Term,OtherLineC),
  665:              check_content(Term, [OtherLineC,$$]),
  666:              check_location(Term, {0, Cols - Col - width(U)+1}),
  667: 
  668:              send_tty(Term,OtherLineD),
  669:              check_content(Term, [OtherLineD,$$]),
  670:              check_location(Term, {0, Cols - Col - width(U)+1}),
  671: 
  672:              send_tty(Term,"C-A"),
  673:              check_location(Term, {-4, 0}), %% Broken
  674:              send_tty(Term,"Right"),
  675:              check_location(Term, {-4, width(U)}), %% Broken
  676: 
  677:              send_tty(Term,"DC"), %% Broken
  678:              check_content(Term, ["a.*",U,"$"]),
  679:              check_content(Term, ["^b.*",U,"c$"]),
  680:              check_content(Term, ["^c.*",U,"dd$"]),
  681: 
  682:              send_tty(Term,"a"),
  683:              check_content(Term, [FirstLine,$$]),
  684:              check_content(Term, [OtherLineA,$$]),
  685:              check_content(Term, [OtherLineB,$$]),
  686:              check_content(Term, [OtherLineC,$$]),
  687:              check_content(Term, [OtherLineD,$$]),
  688: 
  689:              send_tty(Term,"Enter")
  690:          end || U <- hard_unicode()]
  691:     after
  692:         stop_tty(Term)
  693:     end.
  694: 
  695: shell_delete(Config) ->
  696: 
  697:     Term = start_tty(Config),
  698: 
  699:     try
  700: 
  701:         [ begin
  702:               send_tty(Term,"a"),
  703:               check_content(Term, "> a$"),
  704:               check_location(Term, {0, 1}),
  705:               send_tty(Term,"BSpace"),
  706:               check_location(Term, {0, 0}),
  707:               check_content(Term, ">$"),
  708:               send_tty(Term,"a"),
  709:               send_tty(Term,U),
  710:               check_location(Term, {0, width([$a, U])}),
  711:               send_tty(Term,"a"),
  712:               send_tty(Term,U),
  713:               check_location(Term, {0, width([$a,U,$a,U])}),
  714:               check_content(Term, ["> a",U,$a,U,"$"]),
  715:               send_tty(Term,"Left"),
  716:               send_tty(Term,"Left"),
  717:               send_tty(Term,"BSpace"),
  718:               check_location(Term, {0, width([$a])}),
  719:               check_content(Term, ["> aa",U,"$"]),
  720:               send_tty(Term,U),
  721:               check_location(Term, {0, width([$a,U])}),
  722:               send_tty(Term,"Left"),
  723:               send_tty(Term,"DC"),
  724:               check_location(Term, {0, width([$a])}),
  725:               check_content(Term, ["> aa",U,"$"]),
  726:               send_tty(Term,"DC"),
  727:               send_tty(Term,"DC"),
  728:               check_content(Term, ["> a$"]),
  729:               send_tty(Term,"C-E"),
  730:               check_location(Term, {0, width([$a])}),
  731:               send_tty(Term,"BSpace"),
  732:               check_location(Term, {0, width([])})
  733:           end || U <- hard_unicode()]
  734:     after
  735:         stop_tty(Term)
  736:     end.
  737: 
  738: %% When deleting characters at the edge of the screen that are "large",
  739: %% we need to take special care.
  740: shell_delete_unicode_wrap(Config) ->
  741: 
  742:     Term = start_tty(Config),
  743: 
  744:     {_Rows, Cols} = get_window_size(Term),
  745:     {_Row, Col} = get_location(Term),
  746: 
  747:     try
  748:         [begin
  749:              send_tty(Term,lists:duplicate(Cols - Col,"a")),
  750:              check_content(Term,"> a*$"),
  751:              send_tty(Term,[U,U,"aaaaa"]),
  752:              check_content(Term,["\n",U,U,"aaaaa$"]),
  753:              [send_tty(Term,"Left") || _ <- lists:seq(1,5+2)],
  754:              check_location(Term,{0,-Col}),
  755:              send_tty(Term,"BSpace"),
  756:              check_content(Term,"> a* \n"),
  757:              check_location(Term,{-1,Cols - Col - 1}),
  758:              send_tty(Term,"BSpace"),
  759:              check_content(Term,["> a*",U,"\n"]),
  760:              check_location(Term,{-1,Cols - Col - 2}),
  761:              send_tty(Term,"BSpace"),
  762:              check_content(Term,["> a*",U," \n"]),
  763:              check_location(Term,{-1,Cols - Col - 3}),
  764:              send_tty(Term,"BSpace"),
  765:              check_content(Term,["> a*",U,U,"\n"]),
  766:              check_content(Term,["\naaaaa$"]),
  767:              check_location(Term,{-1,Cols - Col - 4}),
  768:              send_tty(Term,"BSpace"),
  769:              check_content(Term,["> a*",U,U,"a\n"]),
  770:              check_content(Term,["\naaaa$"]),
  771:              check_location(Term,{-1,Cols - Col - 5}),
  772:              send_tty(Term,"Enter")
  773:          end || U <- hard_unicode()]
  774:     after
  775:         stop_tty(Term)
  776:     end.
  777: 
  778: %% When deleting characters and a "large" characters is changing line we need
  779: %% to take extra care
  780: shell_delete_unicode_not_at_cursor_wrap(Config) ->
  781: 
  782:     Term = start_tty(Config),
  783: 
  784:     {_Rows, Cols} = get_window_size(Term),
  785:     {_Row, Col} = get_location(Term),
  786: 
  787:     try
  788:         [begin
  789:              send_tty(Term,lists:duplicate(Cols - Col,"a")),
  790:              check_content(Term,"> a*$"),
  791:              send_tty(Term,["a",U,"aaaaa"]),
  792:              check_content(Term,["\na",U,"aaaaa$"]),
  793:              send_tty(Term,"C-A"),
  794:              send_tty(Term,"DC"),
  795:              check_content(Term,["\n",U,"aaaaa$"]),
  796:              send_tty(Term,"DC"),
  797:              check_content(Term,["\n",U,"aaaaa$"]),
  798:              check_content(Term,["> a* \n"]),
  799:              send_tty(Term,"DC"),
  800:              check_content(Term,["\naaaaa$"]),
  801:              check_content(Term,["> a*",U,"\n"]),
  802:              send_tty(Term,"DC"),
  803:              check_content(Term,["\naaaa$"]),
  804:              check_content(Term,["> a*",U,"a\n"]),
  805:              send_tty(Term,"Enter")
  806:          end || U <- hard_unicode()]
  807:     after
  808:         stop_tty(Term)
  809:     end.
  810: 
  811: %% When deleting characters and a "large" characters is changing line we need
  812: %% to take extra care
  813: shell_update_window_unicode_wrap(Config) ->
  814: 
  815:     Term = start_tty(Config),
  816: 
  817:     {_Rows, Cols} = get_window_size(Term),
  818:     {_Row, Col} = get_location(Term),
  819: 
  820:     try
  821:         [begin
  822:              send_tty(Term,lists:duplicate(Cols - Col - width(U) + 1,"a")),
  823:              check_content(Term,"> a*$"),
  824:              send_tty(Term,[U,"aaaaa"]),
  825:              check_content(Term,["> a* ?\n",U,"aaaaa$"]),
  826:              tmux(["resize-window -t ",tty_name(Term)," -x ",Cols+1]),
  827:              check_content(Term,["> a*",U,"\naaaaa$"]),
  828:              tmux(["resize-window -t ",tty_name(Term)," -x ",Cols]),
  829:              check_content(Term,["> a* ?\n",U,"aaaaa$"]),
  830:              send_tty(Term,"Enter")
  831:          end || U <- hard_unicode()]
  832:     after
  833:         stop_tty(Term)
  834:     end.
  835: 
  836: shell_transpose(Config) ->
  837: 
  838:     Term = start_tty(Config),
  839: 
  840:     Unicode = [[$a]] ++ hard_unicode(),
  841: 
  842:     try
  843:         [
  844:          begin
  845:              send_tty(Term,"a"),
  846:              [send_tty(Term,[CP]) || CP <- U],
  847:              send_tty(Term,"b"),
  848:              [[send_tty(Term,[CP]) || CP <- U2] || U2 <- Unicode],
  849:              send_tty(Term,"cde"),
  850:              check_content(Term, ["a",U,"b",Unicode,"cde$"]),
  851:              check_location(Term, {0, width(["a",U,"b",Unicode,"cde"])}),
  852:              send_tty(Term,"Home"),
  853:              check_location(Term, {0, 0}),
  854:              send_tty(Term,"Right"),
  855:              send_tty(Term,"Right"),
  856:              check_location(Term, {0, 1+width([U])}),
  857:              send_tty(Term,"C-T"),
  858:              check_content(Term, ["ab",U,Unicode,"cde$"]),
  859:              send_tty(Term,"C-T"),
  860:              check_content(Term, ["ab",hd(Unicode),U,tl(Unicode),"cde$"]),
  861:              [send_tty(Term,"C-T") || _ <- lists:seq(1,length(Unicode)-1)],
  862:              check_content(Term, ["ab",Unicode,U,"cde$"]),
  863:              send_tty(Term,"C-T"),
  864:              check_content(Term, ["ab",Unicode,"c",U,"de$"]),
  865:              check_location(Term, {0, width(["ab",Unicode,"c",U])}),
  866:              send_tty(Term,"End"),
  867:              check_location(Term, {0, width(["ab",Unicode,"c",U,"de"])}),
  868:              send_tty(Term,"Left"),
  869:              send_tty(Term,"Left"),
  870:              send_tty(Term,"BSpace"),
  871:              check_content(Term, ["ab",Unicode,"cde$"]),
  872:              send_tty(Term,"End"),
  873:              send_tty(Term,"Enter")
  874:          end || U <- Unicode],
  875:         ok
  876:     after
  877:         stop_tty(Term),
  878:         ok
  879:     end.
  880: 
  881: shell_search(C) ->
  882:     Term = start_tty(C),
  883: 
  884:     try
  885:         send_tty(Term,"a"),
  886:         send_tty(Term,"."),
  887:         send_tty(Term,"Enter"),
  888:         send_tty(Term,"'"),
  889:         send_tty(Term,"a"),
  890:         send_tty(Term,[16#1f600]),
  891:         send_tty(Term,"'"),
  892:         send_tty(Term,"."),
  893:         send_tty(Term,"Enter"),
  894:         check_location(Term, {0, 0}),
  895:         send_tty(Term,"C-r"),
  896:         check_content(Term, "search:\\s*\n\\s*'a'."),
  897:         send_tty(Term,"C-a"),
  898:         check_location(Term, {-1, width(C, "'a'.")}),
  899:         send_tty(Term,"Enter"),
  900:         send_tty(Term,"C-r"),
  901:         check_content(Term, "search:\\s*\n\\s*'a'."),
  902:         send_tty(Term,"a"),
  903:         check_content(Term, "search: a\\s*\n\\s*'a'."),
  904:         send_tty(Term,"C-r"),
  905:         check_content(Term, "search: a\\s*\n\\s*a."),
  906:         send_tty(Term,"BSpace"),
  907:         check_content(Term, "search:\\s*\n\\s*'a'."),
  908:         send_tty(Term,"BSpace"),
  909:         check_content(Term, "search:\\s*\n\\s*'a'."),
  910:         send_tty(Term,"M-c"),
  911:         check_location(Term, {-1, 0}),
  912:         ok
  913:     after
  914:         stop_tty(Term),
  915:         ok
  916:     end.
  917: 
  918: shell_insert(Config) ->
  919:     Term = start_tty(Config),
  920: 
  921:     try
  922:         send_tty(Term,"abcdefghijklm"),
  923:         check_content(Term, "abcdefghijklm$"),
  924:         check_location(Term, {0, 13}),
  925:         send_tty(Term,"Home"),
  926:         send_tty(Term,"Right"),
  927:         send_tty(Term,"C-T"),
  928:         send_tty(Term,"C-T"),
  929:         send_tty(Term,"C-T"),
  930:         send_tty(Term,"C-T"),
  931:         check_content(Term, "bcdeafghijklm$"),
  932:         send_tty(Term,"End"),
  933:         send_tty(Term,"Left"),
  934:         send_tty(Term,"Left"),
  935:         send_tty(Term,"BSpace"),
  936:         check_content(Term, "bcdeafghijlm$"),
  937:         ok
  938:     after
  939:         stop_tty(Term)
  940:     end.
  941: 
  942: shell_update_window(Config) ->
  943:     Term = start_tty(Config),
  944: 
  945:     Text = lists:flatten(["abcdefghijklmabcdefghijklm"]),
  946:     {_Row, Col} = get_location(Term),
  947: 
  948:     try
  949:         send_tty(Term,Text),
  950:         check_content(Term,Text),
  951:         check_location(Term, {0, width(Text)}),
  952:         tmux(["resize-window -t ",tty_name(Term)," -x ",width(Text)+Col+1]),
  953:         send_tty(Term,"a"),
  954:         check_location(Term, {0, -Col}),
  955:         send_tty(Term,"BSpace"),
  956:         check_location(Term, {-1, width(Text)}),
  957:         tmux(["resize-window -t ",tty_name(Term)," -x ",width(Text)+Col]),
  958:         %% When resizing, tmux does not xnfix the cursor, so it will remain
  959:         %% at the previous locations
  960:         check_location(Term, {-1, width(Text)}),
  961:         send_tty(Term,"a"),
  962:         check_location(Term, {0, -Col + 1}),
  963: 
  964:         %% When we do backspace here, tmux seems to place the cursor in an
  965:         %% incorrect position except when a terminal is attached.
  966:         send_tty(Term,"BSpace"),
  967:         %% This really should be {0, -Col}, but sometimes tmux sets it to
  968:         %% {-1, width(Text)} instead.
  969:         check_location(Term, [{0, -Col}, {-1, width(Text)}]),
  970: 
  971:         tmux(["resize-window -t ",tty_name(Term)," -x ",width(Text) div 2 + Col]),
  972:         %% Depending on what happened with the cursor above, the line will be
  973:         %% different here.
  974:         check_location(Term, [{0, -Col + width(Text) div 2},
  975:                               {-1, -Col + width(Text) div 2}]),
  976:         ok
  977:     after
  978:         stop_tty(Term)
  979:     end.
  980: shell_small_window_multiline_navigation(Config) ->
  981:     Term0 = start_tty(Config),
  982:     tmux(["resize-window -t ",tty_name(Term0)," -x ",30, " -y ", 6]),
  983:     {Row, Col} = get_location(Term0),
  984:     Term = Term0#tmux{orig_location = {Row, Col}},
  985:     Text = ("xbcdefghijklmabcdefghijklm\n"++
  986:         "abcdefghijkl\n"++
  987:         "abcdefghijklmabcdefghijklm\n"++
  988:         "abcdefghijklmabcdefghijklx"),
  989:     try
  990:         send_tty(Term,Text),
  991:         check_location(Term, {0, -4}),
  992:         send_tty(Term,"Home"),
  993:         check_location(Term, {-1, 0}),
  994:         send_tty(Term, "C-Up"),
  995:         check_location(Term, {-2, 0}),
  996:         send_tty(Term, "C-Down"),
  997:         check_location(Term, {-1, 0}),
  998:         send_tty(Term, "Left"),
  999:         check_location(Term, {-1, -4}),
 1000:         send_tty(Term, "Right"),
 1001:         check_location(Term, {-1, 0}),
 1002:         send_tty(Term, "\e[1;4A"),
 1003:         check_location(Term, {-5, 0}),
 1004:         check_content(Term,"xbc"),
 1005:         send_tty(Term, "\e[1;4B"),
 1006:         check_location(Term, {0, -4}),
 1007:         check_content(Term,"klx"),
 1008:         send_tty(Term, " sets:is_e\t"),
 1009:         check_content(Term,"is_element"),
 1010:         check_content(Term,"is_empty"),
 1011:         check_location(Term, {-3, 6}),
 1012:         send_tty(Term, "C-Up"),
 1013:         send_tty(Term,"Home"),
 1014:         check_location(Term, {-2, 0}),
 1015:         send_tty(Term, "sets:is_e\t"),
 1016:         check_content(Term,"is_element"),
 1017:         check_content(Term,"is_empty"),
 1018:         check_location(Term, {-4, 9}),
 1019:         send_tty(Term, "M-Enter"),
 1020:         check_location(Term, {-1, 0}),
 1021:         ok
 1022:     after
 1023:         stop_tty(Term)
 1024:     end.
 1025: shell_huge_input(Config) ->
 1026:     Term = start_tty(Config),
 1027: 
 1028:     ManyUnicode = lists:duplicate(100,hard_unicode()),
 1029: 
 1030:     try
 1031:         send_tty(Term,ManyUnicode),
 1032:         check_content(Term, hard_unicode_match(Config) ++ "$",
 1033:                       #{ replace => {"\n",""} }),
 1034:         send_tty(Term,"Enter"),
 1035:         ok
 1036:     after
 1037:         stop_tty(Term)
 1038:     end.
 1039: shell_receive_standard_out(Config) ->
 1040:     Term = start_tty(Config),
 1041:     try
 1042:         send_tty(Term,"my_fun(5) -> ok; my_fun(N) -> receive after 100 -> io:format(\"~p\\n\", [N]), my_fun(N+1) end.\n"),
 1043:         send_tty(Term, "spawn(shell_default, my_fun, [0]). ABC\n"),
 1044:         timer:sleep(1000),
 1045:         check_location(Term, {0, 0}), %% Check that we are at the same location relative to the start.
 1046:         check_content(Term, "3\\s+4\\s+.+>\\sABC"),
 1047:         ok
 1048:     after
 1049:         stop_tty(Term)
 1050:     end.
 1051: %% Test that the shell works when invalid utf-8 (aka latin1) is sent to it
 1052: shell_invalid_unicode(Config) ->
 1053:     Term = start_tty(Config),
 1054: 
 1055:     InvalidUnicode = <<$,$,$>>, %%  in latin1
 1056: 
 1057:     try
 1058:         send_tty(Term,hard_unicode()),
 1059:         check_content(Term, hard_unicode() ++ "$"),
 1060:         send_tty(Term,"Enter"),
 1061:         check_content(Term, "illegal character"),
 1062:         %% Send invalid utf-8
 1063:         send_stdin(Term,InvalidUnicode),
 1064:         %% Check that the utf-8 was echoed
 1065:         check_content(Term, "\\\\345\\\\344\\\\366$"),
 1066:         send_tty(Term,"Enter"),
 1067:         %% Check that the terminal entered "latin1" mode
 1068:         send_tty(Term,"."),
 1069:         check_content(Term, "\\Q\\360\\237\\230\\200\\355\\225\\234.\\E$"),
 1070:         send_tty(Term,"Enter"),
 1071:         %% Check that we can reset the encoding to unicode
 1072:         send_tty(Term,"io:setopts([{encoding,unicode}])."),
 1073:         send_tty(Term,"Enter"),
 1074:         check_content(Term, "\nok\n"),
 1075:         send_tty(Term,""),
 1076:         check_content(Term, "$"),
 1077:         ok
 1078:     after
 1079:         stop_tty(Term),
 1080:         ok
 1081:     end.
 1082: 
 1083: 
 1084: %% Test the we can handle ansi insert, navigation and delete
 1085: %%   We currently can not so skip this test
 1086: shell_support_ansi_input(Config) ->
 1087: 
 1088:     Term = start_tty(Config),
 1089: 
 1090:     BoldText = "\e[;1m",
 1091:     ClearText = "\e[0m",
 1092: 
 1093:     try
 1094:         send_stdin(Term,["{",BoldText,"ab",ClearText,"}"]),
 1095:         timer:sleep(1000),
 1096:         try check_location(Term, {0, width("{1mabm}")}) of
 1097:             _ ->
 1098:                 throw({skip, "Do not support ansi input"})
 1099:         catch _:_ ->
 1100:                 ok
 1101:         end,
 1102:         check_location(Term, {0, width("{ab}")}),
 1103:         check_content(fun() -> get_content(Term,"-e") end,
 1104:                       ["{", BoldText, "ab", ClearText, "}"]),
 1105:         send_tty(Term,"Left"),
 1106:         send_tty(Term,"Left"),
 1107:         check_location(Term, {0, width("{a")}),
 1108:         send_tty(Term,"C-Left"),
 1109:         check_location(Term, {0, width("{")}),
 1110:         send_tty(Term,"End"),
 1111:         send_tty(Term,"BSpace"),
 1112:         send_tty(Term,"BSpace"),
 1113:         check_content(Term, ["{", BoldText, "a"]),
 1114:         ok
 1115:     after
 1116:         stop_tty(Term),
 1117:         ok
 1118:     end.
 1119: 
 1120: shell_expand_location_below(Config) ->
 1121: 
 1122:     Term = start_tty(Config),
 1123: 
 1124:     {Rows, _} = get_window_size(Term),
 1125:     {Row, Col} = get_location(Term),
 1126: 
 1127:     NumFunctions = lists:seq(0, Row*2),
 1128:     FunctionName = "a_long_function_name",
 1129: 
 1130:     Module = lists:flatten(
 1131:                ["-module(long_module).\n",
 1132:                 "-export([",lists:join($,,[io_lib:format("~s~p/0",[FunctionName,I]) || I <- NumFunctions]),"]).\n\n",
 1133:                 [io_lib:format("~s~p() -> ok.\n",[FunctionName,I]) || I <- NumFunctions]]),
 1134: 
 1135:     DoScan = fun F([]) ->
 1136:                      [];
 1137:                  F(Str) ->
 1138:                      {done,{ok,T,_},C} = erl_scan:tokens([],Str,0),
 1139:                      [ T | F(C) ]
 1140:              end,
 1141:     Forms = [ begin {ok,Y} = erl_parse:parse_form(X),Y end || X <- DoScan(Module) ],
 1142:     {ok,_,Bin} = compile:forms(Forms, [debug_info]),
 1143: 
 1144:     try
 1145:         tmux(["resize-window -t ",tty_name(Term)," -x 80"]),
 1146:         Cols = 80,
 1147: 
 1148:         %% First check that basic completion works
 1149:         send_stdin(Term, "escript:"),
 1150:         send_stdin(Term, "\t"),
 1151:         %% Cursor at correct place
 1152:         check_location(Term, {-3, width("escript:")}),
 1153:         %% Nothing after the start( completion
 1154:         check_content(Term, "start\\($"),
 1155: 
 1156:         %% Check that completion is cleared when we type
 1157:         send_stdin(Term, "s"),
 1158:         check_location(Term, {-3, width("escript:s")}),
 1159:         check_content(Term, "escript:s$"),
 1160: 
 1161:         %% Check that completion works when in the middle of a term
 1162:         send_tty(Term, "Home"),
 1163:         send_tty(Term, "["),
 1164:         send_tty(Term, "End"),
 1165:         send_tty(Term, ", test_after]"),
 1166:         [send_tty(Term, "Left") || _ <- ", test_after]"],
 1167:         send_stdin(Term, "\t"),
 1168:         check_location(Term, {-3, width("[escript:s")}),
 1169:         check_content(Term, "script_name\\([ ]+start\\($"),
 1170:         send_tty(Term, "C-K"),
 1171: 
 1172:         %% Check that completion works when in the middle of a long term
 1173:         send_tty(Term, ", "++ lists:duplicate(80*2, $a)++"]"),
 1174:         [send_tty(Term, "Left") || _ <- ", "++ lists:duplicate(80*2, $a)++"]"],
 1175:         send_stdin(Term, "\t"),
 1176:         check_location(Term, {-4, width("[escript:s")}),
 1177:         check_content(Term, "script_name\\([ ]+start\\($"),
 1178:         send_tty(Term, "End"),
 1179:         send_stdin(Term, ".\n"),
 1180: 
 1181:         %% Check that we behave as we should with very long completions
 1182:         rpc(Term, fun() ->
 1183:                           {module, long_module} = code:load_binary(long_module, "long_module.beam", Bin)
 1184:                   end),
 1185:         check_content(Term, "3>"),
 1186:         tmux(["resize-window -t ",tty_name(Term)," -y 50"]),
 1187:         timer:sleep(1000), %% Sleep to make sure window has resized
 1188:         Result = 61,
 1189:         Rows1 = 48,
 1190:         send_stdin(Term, "long_module:" ++ FunctionName),
 1191:         send_stdin(Term, "\t"),
 1192:         check_content(Term, "3> long_module:" ++ FunctionName ++ "\nfunctions(\n|.)*a_long_function_name0\\("),
 1193: 
 1194:         %% Check that correct text is printed below expansion
 1195:         check_content(Term, io_lib:format("rows ~w to ~w of ~w",
 1196:                                           [1, 7, Result])),
 1197:         send_stdin(Term, "\t"),
 1198:         check_content(Term, io_lib:format("rows ~w to ~w of ~w",
 1199:             [1, Rows1, Result])),
 1200:         send_tty(Term, "Down"),
 1201:         check_content(Term, io_lib:format("rows ~w to ~w of ~w",
 1202:                                           [2, Rows1+1, Result])),
 1203:         send_tty(Term, "PgDn"),
 1204:         check_content(Term, io_lib:format("rows ~w to ~w of ~w",
 1205:                                           [7, Rows1+6, Result])),
 1206:         send_tty(Term, "PgUp"),
 1207:         check_content(Term, io_lib:format("rows ~w to ~w of ~w",
 1208:                                           [2, Rows1+1, Result])),
 1209:         send_tty(Term, "PgUp"),
 1210:         %% Overshoot up
 1211:         check_content(Term, io_lib:format("rows ~w to ~w of ~w",
 1212:                                           [1, Rows1, Result])),
 1213:         %% Overshoot down
 1214:         send_tty(Term, "PgDn"),
 1215:         send_tty(Term, "PgDn"),
 1216:         send_tty(Term, "PgDn"),
 1217:         check_content(Term, io_lib:format("rows ~w to ~w of ~w",
 1218:                                           [14, Rows1+13, Result])),
 1219:         check_content(Term, "\n.*a_long_function_name99\\("),
 1220:         send_tty(Term, "Up"),
 1221:         check_content(Term, io_lib:format("rows ~w to ~w of ~w",
 1222:                                           [13, Rows1+12, Result])),
 1223: 
 1224:         send_tty(Term, "\t"),
 1225: 
 1226:         %% We resize the terminal to make everything fit and test that
 1227:         %% expand below displays everything
 1228:         tmux(["resize-window -t ", tty_name(Term), " -y ", integer_to_list(Row+10)]),
 1229:         timer:sleep(1000), %% Sleep to make sure window has resized
 1230:         send_tty(Term, "\t\t"),
 1231:         check_content(Term, "3> long_module:" ++ FunctionName ++ "\nfunctions(\n|.)*a_long_function_name99\\($"),
 1232: 
 1233:         %% Check that doing an expansion when cursor is in xnfix position works
 1234:         send_tty(Term, "BSpace"),
 1235:         check_content(Term, "3> long_module:a_long_function_nam$"),
 1236:         send_tty(Term, "Home"),
 1237:         send_tty(Term, lists:duplicate(Cols - Col - width(", long_module:a_long_function_name"), "a")),
 1238:         send_tty(Term, ", "),
 1239:         send_tty(Term, "End"),
 1240:         send_tty(Term, "\t"),
 1241:         check_location(Term, {-Rows + 2, -Col}),
 1242:         send_tty(Term, "\t"),
 1243:         check_content(Term, "3> a+, long_module:" ++ FunctionName ++ "\n\nfunctions(\n|.)*a_long_function_name0\\("),
 1244:         check_location(Term, {-Rows + 2, -Col}),
 1245:         send_tty(Term, "Down"),
 1246:         check_location(Term, {-Rows + 2, -Col}),
 1247:         send_tty(Term, "Down"),
 1248:         check_location(Term, {-Rows + 2, -Col}),
 1249: 
 1250:         send_tty(Term, "Home"),
 1251:         send_tty(Term, lists:duplicate(Cols, "b")),
 1252:         send_tty(Term, "End"),
 1253:         send_tty(Term, "\t"),
 1254:         check_content(Term, "3> b+\nb+a+, long_module:" ++ FunctionName ++ "\n\nfunctions(\n|.)*a_long_function_name0\\("),
 1255:         check_location(Term, {-Rows + 3, -Col}),
 1256:         send_tty(Term, "Down"),
 1257:         check_location(Term, {-Rows + 3, -Col}),
 1258:         send_tty(Term, "Down"),
 1259:         check_location(Term, {-Rows + 3, -Col}),
 1260: 
 1261:         ok
 1262:     after
 1263:         stop_tty(Term),
 1264:         ok
 1265:     end.
 1266: 
 1267: shell_expand_location_above(Config) ->
 1268: 
 1269:     Term = start_tty([{args,["-stdlib","shell_expand_location","above"]}|Config]),
 1270: 
 1271:     try
 1272:         tmux(["resize-window -t ",tty_name(Term)," -x 80"]),
 1273:         send_stdin(Term, "escript:"),
 1274:         send_stdin(Term, "\t"),
 1275:         check_location(Term, {0, width("escript:")}),
 1276:         check_content(Term, "start\\(\n"),
 1277:         check_content(Term, "escript:$"),
 1278:         send_stdin(Term, "s"),
 1279:         send_stdin(Term, "\t"),
 1280:         check_location(Term, {0, width("escript:s")}),
 1281:         check_content(Term, "\nscript_name\\([ ]+start\\(\n"),
 1282:         check_content(Term, "escript:s$"),
 1283:         ok
 1284:     after
 1285:         stop_tty(Term),
 1286:         ok
 1287:     end.
 1288: 
 1289: shell_help(Config) ->
 1290:     Term = start_tty(Config),
 1291:     try
 1292:         send_stdin(Term, "lists"),
 1293:         send_stdin(Term, "\^[h"),
 1294:         check_content(Term, "List processing functions."),
 1295:         send_stdin(Term, ":all"),
 1296:         send_stdin(Term, "\^[h"),
 1297:         check_content(Term, "-spec all(Pred, List) -> boolean()"),
 1298:         ok
 1299:     after
 1300:         stop_tty(Term),
 1301:         ok
 1302:     end.
 1303: %% Test the we can handle invalid ansi escape chars.
 1304: %%   tmux cannot handle this... so we test this using to_erl
 1305: shell_invalid_ansi(_Config) ->
 1306: 
 1307:     InvalidAnsiPrompt =
 1308:         case proplists:get_value(encoding, io:getopts(user)) of
 1309:             unicode ->
 1310:                 ["\e]94m",54620,44397,50612,47,51312,49440,47568,"\e]0m"];
 1311:             latin1 ->
 1312:                 ["\e]94minvalid_test\e]0m"]
 1313:         end,
 1314: 
 1315:     rtnode:run(
 1316:       [{eval, fun() -> application:set_env(
 1317:                          stdlib, shell_prompt_func_test,
 1318:                          fun() -> InvalidAnsiPrompt end)
 1319:               end },
 1320:        {putline,"a."},
 1321:        {expect, "a[.]"},
 1322:        {expect, ["\\Q",InvalidAnsiPrompt,"\\E"]}],
 1323:       "", "",
 1324:       ["-pz",filename:dirname(code:which(?MODULE)),
 1325:        "-connect_all","false",
 1326:        "-kernel","logger_level","all",
 1327:        "-kernel","shell_history","disabled",
 1328:        "-kernel","prevent_overlapping_partitions","false",
 1329:        "-eval","shell:prompt_func({interactive_shell_SUITE,prompt})."
 1330:       ]).
 1331: 
 1332: shell_ignore_pager_commands(Config) ->
 1333:     Term = start_tty(Config),
 1334:     case code:get_doc(file, #{sources=>[eep48]}) of
 1335:         {error, _} -> {skip, "No documentation available"};
 1336:         _ ->
 1337:             try
 1338:                 send_tty(Term, "h(file).\n"),
 1339:                 check_content(Term,"\\Qmore (y/n)? (y)\\E"),
 1340:                 send_tty(Term, "n\n"),
 1341:                 check_content(Term,"ok"),
 1342:                 send_tty(Term, "C-P"),
 1343:                 check_content(Term,"\\Qh(file).\\E"),
 1344:                 ok
 1345:             after
 1346:                 stop_tty(Term),
 1347:                 ok
 1348:             end
 1349:     end.
 1350: test_valid_keymap(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1351:     DataDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir,Config),
 1352:     Term = setup_tty([{args, ["-config", DataDir ++ "valid_keymap.config"]} | Config]),
 1353:     Prompt = fun() -> ["\e[94m",54620,44397,50612,47,51312,49440,47568,"\e[0m"] end,
 1354:     erpc:call(Term#tmux.node, application, set_env,
 1355:               [stdlib, shell_prompt_func_test,
 1356:                proplists:get_value(shell_prompt_func_test, Config, Prompt)]),
 1357:     try
 1358:         check_not_in_content(Term, "Invalid key"),
 1359:         check_not_in_content(Term, "Invalid function"),
 1360:         send_tty(Term, "asdf"),
 1361:         send_tty(Term, "C-u"),
 1362:         check_content(Term, ">$"),
 1363:         send_tty(Term, "1.\n"),
 1364:         send_tty(Term, "C-b"),
 1365:         check_content(Term, "2>\\s1.$"),
 1366:         ok
 1367:     after
 1368:         stop_tty(Term),
 1369:         ok
 1370:     end.
 1371: 
 1372: test_invalid_keymap(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1373:     DataDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir,Config),
 1374:     Term1 = setup_tty([{args, ["-config", DataDir ++ "invalid_keymap.config"]} | Config]),
 1375:     try
 1376:         check_content(Term1, "Invalid key"),
 1377:         check_content(Term1, "Invalid function"),
 1378:         send_tty(Term1, "asdf"),
 1379:         send_tty(Term1, "C-u"),
 1380:         check_content(Term1, ">$"),
 1381:         ok
 1382:     after
 1383:         stop_tty(Term1),
 1384:         ok
 1385:     end.
 1386: external_editor(Config) ->
 1387:     case os:find_executable("nano") of
 1388:         false -> {skip, "nano is not installed"};
 1389:         _ ->
 1390:             Term = start_tty(Config),
 1391:             try
 1392:                 tmux(["resize-window -t ",tty_name(Term)," -x 80"]),
 1393:                 send_tty(Term,"os:putenv(\"EDITOR\",\"nano\").\n"),
 1394:                 send_tty(Term, "\"some text with\nnewline in it\""),
 1395:                 check_content(Term,"3> \"some text with\\s*\n.+\\s*newline in it\""),
 1396:                 send_tty(Term, "C-O"),
 1397:                 check_content(Term,"GNU nano [\\d.]+"),
 1398:                 check_content(Term,"\"some text with\\s*\n\\s*newline in it\""),
 1399:                 send_tty(Term, "Right"),
 1400:                 send_tty(Term, "still"),
 1401:                 send_tty(Term, "Enter"),
 1402:                 send_tty(Term, "C-O"), %% save in nano
 1403:                 send_tty(Term, "Enter"),
 1404:                 send_tty(Term, "C-X"), %% quit in nano
 1405:                 check_content(Term,"3> \"still\\s*\n\\s*.+\\s*some text with\\s*\n.+\\s*newline in it\""),
 1406:                 send_tty(Term,".\n"),
 1407:                 check_content(Term,"\\Q\"still\\nsome text with\\nnewline in it\"\\E"),
 1408:                 ok
 1409:             after
 1410:                 stop_tty(Term),
 1411:                 ok
 1412:             end
 1413:     end.
 1414: 
 1415: external_editor_visual(Config) ->
 1416:     case os:find_executable("vim") of
 1417:         false ->
 1418:             {skip, "vim is not installed"};
 1419:         _ ->
 1420:             Term = start_tty(Config),
 1421:             try
 1422:                 tmux(["resize-window -t ",tty_name(Term)," -x 80"]),
 1423:                 send_tty(Term,"os:putenv(\"EDITOR\",\"nano\").\n"),
 1424:                 check_content(Term, "3>"),
 1425:                 send_tty(Term,"os:putenv(\"VISUAL\",\"vim -u DEFAULTS -U NONE -i NONE\").\n"),
 1426:                 check_content(Term, "4>"),
 1427:                 send_tty(Term,"\"hello"),
 1428:                 send_tty(Term, "C-O"), %% Open vim
 1429:                 check_content(Term, "^\"hello"),
 1430:                 send_tty(Term, "$"), %% Set cursor at end
 1431:                 send_tty(Term, "a"), %% Enter insert mode at end
 1432:                 check_content(Term, "-- INSERT --"),
 1433:                 send_tty(Term, "\"."),
 1434:                 send_tty(Term,"Escape"),
 1435:                 send_tty(Term,":wq"),
 1436:                 send_tty(Term,"Enter"),
 1437:                 check_content(Term, "\"hello\"[.]$"),
 1438:                 send_tty(Term,"Enter"),
 1439:                 check_content(Term, "\"hello\""),
 1440:                 check_content(Term, "5>$")
 1441:             after
 1442:                 stop_tty(Term),
 1443:                 ok
 1444:             end
 1445:     end.
 1446: 
 1447: external_editor_unicode(Config) ->
 1448:     NanoPath = os:find_executable("nano"),
 1449:     case NanoPath of
 1450:         false -> {skip, "nano is not installed"};
 1451:         _ ->
 1452:             Term = start_tty(Config),
 1453:             try
 1454:                 tmux(["resize-window -t ",tty_name(Term)," -x 80"]),
 1455:                 send_tty(Term,"os:putenv(\"EDITOR\",\"nano\").\n"),
 1456:                 send_tty(Term, hard_unicode()),
 1457:                 check_content(Term,"3> " ++ hard_unicode_match(Config)),
 1458:                 send_tty(Term, "C-O"), %% open external editor (nano)
 1459:                 check_content(Term,"GNU nano [\\d.]+"),
 1460:                 send_tty(Term, "still "),
 1461:                 check_content(Term,"\nstill "),
 1462:                 send_tty(Term, "C-O"), %% save in nano
 1463:                 send_tty(Term, "Enter"),
 1464:                 send_tty(Term, "C-X"), %% quit in nano
 1465:                 check_content(Term,"still "++hard_unicode_match(Config)),
 1466:                 ok
 1467:             after
 1468:                 stop_tty(Term),
 1469:                 ok
 1470:             end
 1471:     end.
 1472: 
 1473: %% There used to be a race condition when using shell:start_interactive where
 1474: %% the newline handling of standard_error did not change correctly to compensate
 1475: %% for the tty changing to canonical mode
 1476: shell_standard_error_nlcr(Config) ->
 1477: 
 1478:     [
 1479:      begin
 1480:          Term = setup_tty([{env,[{"TERM",TERM}]},{args, ["-noshell"]} | Config]),
 1481:          try
 1482:              rpc(Term, io, format, [standard_error,"test~ntest~ntest", []]),
 1483:              check_content(Term, "test\ntest\ntest$"),
 1484:              rpc(Term, fun() -> shell:start_interactive(),
 1485:                                 io:format(standard_error,"test~ntest~ntest", [])
 1486:                        end),
 1487:              check_content(Term, "test\ntest\ntest(\n|.)*test\ntest\ntest")
 1488:          after
 1489:              stop_tty(Term)
 1490:          end
 1491:      end || TERM <- ["dumb",os:getenv("TERM")]].
 1492: 
 1493: %% We test that suspending of `erl` and then resuming restores the shell
 1494: shell_suspend(Config) ->
 1495: 
 1496:     Name = peer:random_name(proplists:get_value(tc_path,Config)),
 1497:     %% In order to suspend `erl` we need it to run in a shell that has job control
 1498:     %% so we start the peer within a tmux window instead of having it be the original
 1499:     %% process.
 1500:     os:cmd("tmux new-window -n " ++ Name ++ " -d -- bash --norc"),
 1501: 
 1502:     Peer = #{ name => Name,
 1503:               post_process_args =>
 1504:                         fun(["new-window","-n",_,"-d","--"|CmdAndArgs]) ->
 1505:                                 FlatCmdAndArgs =
 1506:                                       lists:join(
 1507:                                         " ",[[$',A,$'] || A <- CmdAndArgs]),
 1508:                                 ["send","-t",Name,lists:flatten(FlatCmdAndArgs),"Enter"]
 1509:                         end
 1510:             },
 1511: 
 1512: 
 1513:     Term = start_tty([{peer, Peer}|Config]),
 1514: 
 1515:     try
 1516:         send_tty(Term, hard_unicode()),
 1517:         check_content(Term,["2> ",hard_unicode(),"$"]),
 1518:         send_tty(Term, "C-Z"),
 1519:         check_content(Term,"\\Q[1]+\\E\\s*Stopped"),
 1520:         send_tty(Term, "fg"),
 1521:         send_tty(Term, "Enter"),
 1522:         send_tty(Term, "M-l"),
 1523:         check_content(Term,["2> ",hard_unicode(),"$"]),
 1524:         check_location(Term,{0,width(hard_unicode())}),
 1525:         ok
 1526:     after
 1527:         stop_tty(Term),
 1528:         ok
 1529:     end.
 1530: 
 1531: %% We test that suspending of `erl` and then resuming restores the shell
 1532: shell_full_queue(Config) ->
 1533: 
 1534:     [throw({skip,"Need unbuffered to run"}) || os:find_executable("unbuffered") =:= false],
 1535: 
 1536:     %% In order to fill the read buffer of the terminal we need to get a
 1537:     %% bit creative. We first need to start erl in bash in order to be
 1538:     %% able to get access to job control for suspended processes.
 1539:     %% We then also wrap `erl` in `unbuffer -p` so that we can suspend
 1540:     %% that program in order to block writing to stdout for a while.
 1541: 
 1542:     Name = peer:random_name(proplists:get_value(tc_path,Config)),
 1543:     os:cmd("tmux new-window -n " ++ Name ++ " -d -- bash --norc"),
 1544: 
 1545:     Peer = #{ name => Name,
 1546:               post_process_args =>
 1547:                         fun(["new-window","-n",_,"-d","--"|CmdAndArgs]) ->
 1548:                                 FlatCmdAndArgs = ["unbuffer -p "] ++
 1549:                                       lists:join(
 1550:                                         " ",[[$',A,$'] || A <- CmdAndArgs]),
 1551:                                 ["send","-t",Name,lists:flatten(FlatCmdAndArgs),"Enter"]
 1552:                         end
 1553:             },
 1554: 
 1555: 
 1556:     Term = start_tty([{peer, Peer}|Config]),
 1557: 
 1558:     UnbufferedPid = os:cmd("ps -o ppid= -p " ++ rpc(Term,os,getpid,[])),
 1559: 
 1560:     WriteUntilStopped =
 1561:         fun F(Char) ->
 1562:                 rpc(Term,io,format,[user,[Char],[]]),
 1563:                 put(bytes,get(bytes,0)+1),
 1564:                 receive
 1565:                     stop ->
 1566:                         rpc(Term,io,format,[user,[Char+1],[]])
 1567:                 after 0 -> F(Char)
 1568:                 end
 1569:         end,
 1570: 
 1571:     WaitUntilBlocked =
 1572:         fun(Pid, Ref) ->
 1573:                 (fun F(Cnt) ->
 1574:                          receive
 1575:                              {'DOWN',Ref,_,_,_} = Down ->
 1576:                                  ct:fail({io_format_did_not_block, Down})
 1577:                          after 1000 ->
 1578:                                  ok
 1579:                          end,
 1580:                          case process_info(Pid,dictionary) of
 1581:                              {dictionary,[{bytes,Cnt}]} ->
 1582:                                  ct:log("Bytes until blocked: ~p~n",[Cnt]),
 1583:                                  %% Add one extra byte as for
 1584:                                  %% the current blocking call
 1585:                                  Cnt + 1;
 1586:                              {dictionary,[{bytes,NewCnt}]} ->
 1587:                                  F(NewCnt)
 1588:                          end
 1589:                  end)(0)
 1590:         end,
 1591: 
 1592:     try
 1593:         %% First test that we can suspend and then resume
 1594:         os:cmd("kill -TSTP " ++ UnbufferedPid),
 1595:         check_content(Term,"\\Q[1]+\\E\\s*Stopped"),
 1596:         {Pid, Ref} = spawn_monitor(fun() -> WriteUntilStopped($a) end),
 1597:         WaitUntilBlocked(Pid, Ref),
 1598:         send_tty(Term, "fg"),
 1599:         send_tty(Term, "Enter"),
 1600:         Pid ! stop,
 1601:         check_content(Term,"b$"),
 1602: 
 1603:         send_tty(Term, "."),
 1604:         send_tty(Term, "Enter"),
 1605: 
 1606:         %% Then we test that all characters are written when system
 1607:         %% is terminated just after writing
 1608:         {ok,Cols} = rpc(Term,io,columns,[user]),
 1609:         send_tty(Term, "Enter"),
 1610:         os:cmd("kill -TSTP " ++ UnbufferedPid),
 1611:         check_content(Term,"\\Q[1]+\\E\\s*Stopped"),
 1612:         {Pid2, Ref2} = spawn_monitor(fun() -> WriteUntilStopped($c) end),
 1613:         Bytes = WaitUntilBlocked(Pid2, Ref2) - 1,
 1614:         stop_tty(Term),
 1615:         send_tty(Term, "fg"),
 1616:         send_tty(Term, "Enter"),
 1617:         check_content(
 1618:           fun() ->
 1619:                   tmux(["capture-pane -p -S - -E - -t ",tty_name(Term)])
 1620:           end, lists:flatten([lists:duplicate(Cols,$c) ++ "\n" ||
 1621:                                  _ <- lists:seq(1,(Bytes) div Cols)]
 1622:                              ++ [lists:duplicate((Bytes) rem Cols,$c)])),
 1623:         ct:log("~ts",[tmux(["capture-pane -p -S - -E - -t ",tty_name(Term)])]),
 1624:         ok
 1625:     after
 1626:         stop_tty(Term),
 1627:         ok
 1628:     end.
 1629: 
 1630: get(Key,Default) ->
 1631:     case get(Key) of
 1632:         undefined ->
 1633:             Default;
 1634:         Value ->
 1635:             Value
 1636:     end.
 1637: 
 1638: %% A list of unicode graphemes that are notoriously hard to render
 1639: hard_unicode() ->
 1640:     ZWJ =
 1641:         case os:type() of
 1642:             %% macOS has very good rendering of ZWJ,
 1643:             %% but the cursor does not agree with it..
 1644:             {unix, darwin} -> [];
 1645:             _ -> [[16#1F91A,16#1F3FC]]    % Hand with skintone 
 1646:         end,
 1647:     [[16#1f600],             % Smilie 
 1648:     "",                   % Hangul
 1649:     "Z","a","l","g","o" %% Vertically stacked chars
 1650:      %%"",            % Zero width joiner
 1651:      %%""                % Zero width joiner
 1652:      | ZWJ].
 1653: 
 1654: hard_unicode_match(Config) ->
 1655:     ["\\Q",[unicode_to_octet(Config, U) || U <- hard_unicode()],"\\E"].
 1656: 
 1657: unicode_to_octet(Config, U) ->
 1658:     case ?config(encoding,Config) of
 1659:         unicode -> U;
 1660:         latin1 -> unicode_to_octet(U)
 1661:     end.
 1662: 
 1663: unicode_to_octet(U) ->
 1664:     [if Byte >= 128 -> [$\\,integer_to_list(Byte,8)];
 1665:         true -> Byte
 1666:      end || <<Byte>> <= unicode:characters_to_binary(U)].
 1667: 
 1668: unicode_to_hex(Config, U) ->
 1669:     case ?config(encoding,Config) of
 1670:         unicode -> U;
 1671:         latin1 -> unicode_to_hex(U)
 1672:     end.
 1673: 
 1674: unicode_to_hex(U) when is_integer(U) ->
 1675:     unicode_to_hex([U]);
 1676: unicode_to_hex(Us) ->
 1677:     [if U < 128 -> U;
 1678:         U < 512 -> ["\\",integer_to_list(U,8)];
 1679:         true -> ["\\x{",integer_to_list(U,16),"}"]
 1680:      end || U <- Us].
 1681: 
 1682: width(C, Str) ->
 1683:     case ?config(encoding, C) of
 1684:         unicode -> width(Str);
 1685:         latin1 -> width(unicode_to_octet(Str))
 1686:     end.
 1687: width(Str) ->
 1688:     lists:sum(
 1689:       [npwcwidth(CP) || CP <- lists:flatten(Str)]).
 1690: 
 1691: npwcwidth(CP) ->
 1692:     try prim_tty:npwcwidth(CP)
 1693:     catch error:undef ->
 1694:             if CP =:= 16#D55C ->
 1695:                     2; %% 
 1696:                CP =:= 16#1f91A ->
 1697:                     2; %% hand
 1698:                CP =:= 16#1F3Fc ->
 1699:                     2; %% Skintone
 1700:                CP =:= 16#1f600 ->
 1701:                     2; %% smilie
 1702:                true ->
 1703:                     case lists:member(CP, [775,776,780,785,786,787,788,791,793,794,
 1704:                                            804,813,848,852,854,858,871,875,878]) of
 1705:                         true ->
 1706:                             0;
 1707:                         false ->
 1708:                             1
 1709:                     end
 1710:             end
 1711:     end.
 1712: 
 1713: tmux([Cmd|_] = Command) when is_list(Cmd) ->
 1714:     tmux(lists:concat(Command));
 1715: tmux(Command) ->
 1716:     string:trim(os:cmd(["tmux ",Command])).
 1717: 
 1718: rpc(#tmux{ node = N }, Fun) ->
 1719:     erpc:call(N, Fun).
 1720: rpc(#tmux{ node = N }, M, F, A) ->
 1721:     erpc:call(N, M, F, A).
 1722: 
 1723: %% Setup a TTY, but do not type anything in terminal
 1724: setup_tty(Config) ->
 1725:     Name = maps:get(name,proplists:get_value(peer, Config, #{}),
 1726:                     peer:random_name(proplists:get_value(tc_path, Config))),
 1727: 
 1728:     Envs = lists:flatmap(fun({Key,Value}) ->
 1729:                                  ["-env",Key,Value]
 1730:                          end, proplists:get_value(env,Config,[])),
 1731: 
 1732:     ExtraArgs = proplists:get_value(args,Config,[]),
 1733: 
 1734:     ExecArgs = case os:getenv("TMUX_DEBUG") of
 1735:                    "strace" ->
 1736:                        STraceLog = filename:join(proplists:get_value(priv_dir,Config),
 1737:                                                  Name++".strace"),
 1738:                        ct:pal("Link to strace: file://~ts", [STraceLog]),
 1739:                        [os:find_executable("strace"),"-f",
 1740:                         "-o",STraceLog,
 1741:                         "-e","trace=all",
 1742:                         "-e","read=0,1,2",
 1743:                         "-e","write=0,1,2"
 1744:                        ] ++ string:split(ct:get_progname()," ",all);
 1745:                    "rr" ->
 1746:                        [os:find_executable("cerl"),"-rr"];
 1747:                    _ ->
 1748:                        string:split(ct:get_progname()," ",all)
 1749:                end,
 1750:     DefaultPeerArgs = #{ name => Name,
 1751:                          exec =>
 1752:                              {os:find_executable("tmux"),
 1753:                               ["new-window","-n",Name,"-d","--"] ++ ExecArgs },
 1754: 
 1755:                          args => ["-pz",filename:dirname(code:which(?MODULE)),
 1756:                                   "-connect_all","false",
 1757: %                                  "-kernel","logger_level","all",
 1758:                                   "-kernel","shell_history","disabled",
 1759:                                   "-kernel","prevent_overlapping_partitions","false",
 1760:                                   "-eval","shell:prompt_func({interactive_shell_SUITE,prompt})."
 1761:                                  ] ++ Envs ++ ExtraArgs,
 1762:                          wait_boot => 60_000,
 1763:                          detached => false
 1764:                        },
 1765: 
 1766:     {ok, Peer, Node} =
 1767:         ?CT_PEER(maps:merge(proplists:get_value(peer,Config,#{}),
 1768:                             DefaultPeerArgs)),
 1769: 
 1770:     Self = self(),
 1771: 
 1772:     %% By default peer links with the starter. For these TCs we however only
 1773:     %% want the peer to die if we die, so we create a "unidirection link" using
 1774:     %% monitors.
 1775:     spawn(fun() ->
 1776:                   TCRef = erlang:monitor(process, Self),
 1777:                   PeerRef = erlang:monitor(process, Peer),
 1778:                   receive
 1779:                       {'DOWN',TCRef,_,_,Reason} ->
 1780:                           exit(Peer, Reason);
 1781:                       {'DOWN',PeerRef,_,_,_} ->
 1782:                           ok
 1783:                   end
 1784:           end),
 1785:     unlink(Peer),
 1786: 
 1787:     "" = tmux(["set-option -t ",Name," remain-on-exit on"]),
 1788: 
 1789:     %% We start tracing on the remote node in order to help debugging
 1790:     TraceLog = filename:join(proplists:get_value(priv_dir,Config),Name++".trace"),
 1791:     ct:log("Link to trace: file://~ts",[TraceLog]),
 1792: 
 1793:     spawn(Node,
 1794:           fun() ->
 1795:                   {ok, _} = dbg:tracer(file,TraceLog),
 1796:                   %% dbg:p(whereis(user_drv),[c,m]),
 1797:                   %% dbg:p(whereis(user_drv_writer),[c,m]),
 1798:                   %% dbg:p(whereis(user_drv_reader),[c,m]),
 1799:                   %% dbg:tp(user_drv,x),
 1800:                   %% dbg:tp(prim_tty,x),
 1801:                   %% dbg:tpl(prim_tty,write_nif,x),
 1802:                   %% dbg:tpl(prim_tty,read_nif,x),
 1803:                   monitor(process, Self),
 1804:                   receive _ -> ok end
 1805:           end),
 1806: 
 1807:     #tmux{ peer = Peer, node = Node, name = Name }.
 1808: 
 1809: %% Start a tty, setup custom prompt and set cursor at bottom
 1810: start_tty(Config) ->
 1811: 
 1812:     Term = setup_tty(Config),
 1813: 
 1814:     Prompt = fun() -> ["\e[94m",54620,44397,50612,47,51312,49440,47568,"\e[0m"] end,
 1815:     erpc:call(Term#tmux.node, application, set_env,
 1816:               [stdlib, shell_prompt_func_test,
 1817:                proplists:get_value(shell_prompt_func_test, Config, Prompt)]),
 1818: 
 1819:     {Rows, _} = get_window_size(Term),
 1820: 
 1821:     %% We send a lot of newlines here in order for the number of rows
 1822:     %% in the window to be max so that we can predict what the cursor
 1823:     %% position is.
 1824:     [send_tty(Term,"\n") || _ <- lists:seq(1, Rows)],
 1825: 
 1826:     %% We enter an 'a' here so that we can get the correct orig position
 1827:     %% with an alternative prompt.
 1828:     send_tty(Term,"a.\n"),
 1829:     check_content(Term,"2>$"),
 1830:     OrigLocation = get_location(Term),
 1831:     Term#tmux{ orig_location = OrigLocation }.
 1832: 
 1833: prompt(L) ->
 1834:     N = proplists:get_value(history, L, 0),
 1835:     Fun = application:get_env(stdlib, shell_prompt_func_test,
 1836:                               fun() -> atom_to_list(node()) end),
 1837:     io_lib:format("(~ts)~w> ",[Fun(),N]).
 1838: 
 1839: stop_tty(Term) ->
 1840:     catch peer:stop(Term#tmux.peer),
 1841:     ct:log("~ts",[get_content(Term, "-e")]),
 1842: %    "" = tmux("kill-window -t " ++ Term#tmux.name),
 1843:     ok.
 1844: 
 1845: tty_name(Term) ->
 1846:     Term#tmux.name.
 1847: 
 1848: send_tty(Term, "Home") ->
 1849:     %% https://stackoverflow.com/a/55616731
 1850:     send_tty(Term,"Escape"),
 1851:     send_tty(Term,"OH");
 1852: send_tty(Term, "End") ->
 1853:     send_tty(Term,"Escape"),
 1854:     send_tty(Term,"OF");
 1855: send_tty(#tmux{ name = Name } = _Term,Value) ->
 1856:     [Head | Quotes] = string:split(Value, "'", all),
 1857:     "" = tmux("send -t " ++ Name ++ " '" ++ Head ++ "'"),
 1858:     [begin
 1859:          "" = tmux("send -t " ++ Name ++ " \"'\""),
 1860:          "" = tmux("send -t " ++ Name ++ " '" ++ V ++ "'")
 1861:      end || V <- Quotes].
 1862: 
 1863: %% We use send_stdin for testing of things that we cannot sent via
 1864: %% the tmux send command, such as invalid unicode
 1865: send_stdin(Term, Chars) when is_binary(Chars) ->
 1866:     rpc(Term,erlang,display_string,[stdin,Chars]);
 1867: send_stdin(Term, Chars) ->
 1868:     send_stdin(Term, iolist_to_binary(unicode:characters_to_binary(Chars))).
 1869: 
 1870: check_location(Term, Where) ->
 1871:     check_location(Term, Where, 5).
 1872: check_location(Term, Where, Attempt) when is_tuple(Where) ->
 1873:     check_location(Term, [Where], Attempt);
 1874: check_location(#tmux{ orig_location = {OrigRow, OrigCol} = Orig } = Term,
 1875:                Where, Attempt) ->
 1876:     NewLocation = get_location(Term),
 1877:     case lists:any(fun({AdjRow, AdjCol}) ->
 1878:                            {OrigRow+AdjRow,OrigCol+AdjCol} =:= NewLocation
 1879:                    end, Where) of
 1880:         true -> NewLocation;
 1881:         false when Attempt =:= 0 ->
 1882:             {NewRow, NewCol} = NewLocation,
 1883:             ct:fail({wrong_location, {expected,Where},
 1884:                      {got,{NewRow - OrigRow, NewCol - OrigCol},
 1885:                       {NewLocation, Orig}}});
 1886:         false ->
 1887:             timer:sleep(50),
 1888:             check_location(Term, Where, Attempt -1)
 1889:     end.
 1890: 
 1891: get_location(Term) ->
