 1892:     RowAndCol = tmux("display -pF '#{cursor_y} #{cursor_x}' -t "++Term#tmux.name),
 1893:     [Row, Col] = string:lexemes(string:trim(RowAndCol,both)," "),
 1894:     {list_to_integer(Row), list_to_integer(Col)}.
 1895: 
 1896: get_window_size(Term) ->
 1897:     RowAndCol = tmux("display -pF '#{window_height} #{window_width}' -t "++Term#tmux.name),
 1898:     [Row, Col] = string:lexemes(string:trim(RowAndCol,both)," "),
 1899:     {list_to_integer(Row), list_to_integer(Col)}.
 1900: 
 1901: check_not_in_content(Term, NegativeMatch) ->
 1902:     check_not_in_content(Term, NegativeMatch, #{}, 5).
 1903: check_not_in_content(Term, NegativeMatch, Opts, Attempt) ->
 1904:     Opts = #{},
 1905:     OrigContent = case Term of
 1906:         #tmux{} -> get_content(Term);
 1907:         Fun when is_function(Fun,0) -> Fun()
 1908:     end,
 1909:     Content = case maps:find(replace, Opts) of
 1910:                 {ok, {RE,Repl} } ->
 1911:                     re:replace(OrigContent, RE, Repl, [global]);
 1912:                 error ->
 1913:                     OrigContent
 1914:                 end,
 1915:     case re:run(string:trim(Content, both), lists:flatten(NegativeMatch), [unicode]) of
 1916:         {match,_} ->
 1917:             io:format("Failed, found '~ts' in ~n'~ts'~n",
 1918:             [unicode:characters_to_binary(NegativeMatch), Content]),
 1919:             io:format("Failed, found '~w' in ~n'~w'~n",
 1920:                         [unicode:characters_to_binary(NegativeMatch), Content]),
 1921:             ct:fail(match);
 1922:         _ when Attempt =:= 0 ->
 1923:             ok;
 1924:         _ ->
 1925:             timer:sleep(500),
 1926:             check_not_in_content(Term, NegativeMatch, Opts, Attempt - 1)
 1927:     end.
 1928: check_content(Term, Match) ->
 1929:     check_content(Term, Match, #{}).
 1930: check_content(Term, Match, Opts) when is_map(Opts) ->
 1931:     check_content(Term, Match, Opts, 5).
 1932: check_content(Term, Match, Opts, Attempt) ->
 1933:     OrigContent = case Term of
 1934:                   #tmux{} -> get_content(Term);
 1935:                   Fun when is_function(Fun,0) -> Fun()
 1936:               end,
 1937:     Content = case maps:find(replace, Opts) of
 1938:                   {ok, {RE,Repl} } ->
 1939:                       re:replace(OrigContent, RE, Repl, [global]);
 1940:                   error ->
 1941:                       OrigContent
 1942:               end,
 1943:     case re:run(string:trim(Content, both), lists:flatten(Match), [unicode]) of
 1944:         {match,_} ->
 1945:             ok;
 1946:         _ when Attempt =:= 0 ->
 1947:             io:format("Failed to find '~ts' in ~n'~ts'~n",
 1948:                       [unicode:characters_to_binary(Match), Content]),
 1949:             io:format("Failed to find '~w' in ~n'~w'~n",
 1950:                       [unicode:characters_to_binary(Match), Content]),
 1951:             ct:fail(nomatch);
 1952:         _ ->
 1953:             timer:sleep(500),
 1954:             check_content(Term, Match, Opts, Attempt - 1)
 1955:     end.
 1956: 
 1957: get_content(Term) ->
 1958:     get_content(Term, "").
 1959: get_content(#tmux{ name = Name }, Args) ->
 1960:     Content = unicode:characters_to_binary(tmux("capture-pane -p " ++ Args ++ " -t " ++ Name)),
 1961:     case string:split(Content,"a.\na") of
 1962:         [_Ignore,C] ->
 1963:             C;
 1964:         [C] ->
 1965:             C
 1966:     end.
 1967: 
 1968: %% Tests that exit of initial shell restarts shell.
 1969: exit_initial(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1970:     case proplists:get_value(default_shell, Config) of
 1971: 	old ->
 1972:             test_exit_initial(old);
 1973:         new ->
 1974:             test_exit_initial(old),
 1975:             test_exit_initial(new)
 1976:     end,
 1977:     ok.
 1978: 
 1979: test_exit_initial(old) ->
 1980:     rtnode:run(
 1981:       [{putline, ""},
 1982:        {putline, "2."},
 1983:        {expect, "2\r\n"},
 1984:        {putline, "exit()."},
 1985:        {expect, "Eshell"},
 1986:        {putline, ""},
 1987:        {putline, "35."},
 1988:        {expect, "35\r\n"}],
 1989:       [], [], ["-oldshell"]);
 1990: test_exit_initial(new) ->
 1991:     rtnode:run(
 1992:       [{putline, ""},
 1993:        {expect, "1> $"},
 1994:        {putline, "2."},
 1995:        {expect, "2"},
 1996:        {putline,"exit()."},
 1997:        {expect, "Eshell"},
 1998:        {expect, "1> $"},
 1999:        {putline, "35."},
 2000:        {expect, "35\r\n"}]).
 2001: 
 2002: stop_during_init(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 2003:     {RunErl,_ToErl,[Erl|ErlArgs]} = rtnode:get_progs(),
 2004:     case rtnode:create_tempdir() of
 2005:         {error, Reason} ->
 2006:             {skip, Reason};
 2007:         Tempdir ->
 2008:             XArg = " -kernel shell_history enabled -s init stop",
 2009:             rtnode:start_runerl_command(RunErl, Tempdir, "\\\""++Erl++"\\\""++ErlArgs++XArg),
 2010:             Logs = rtnode:read_logs(Tempdir),
 2011:             rtnode:dump_logs(Logs),
 2012:             nomatch = binary:match(map_get("erlang.log.1", Logs),
 2013:                                    <<"*** ERROR: Shell process terminated! ***">>),
 2014:             ok
 2015:     end.
 2016: 
 2017: %% This testcase tests that the correct wrapping characters are added
 2018: %% When a terminal has the xn flag set, it means that wrapping may not
 2019: %% work as expected and historically the ttysl driver has always inserted
 2020: %% a " \b" (i.e. space + backspace) when an output string ends on that line
 2021: %% in order for the cursor to be at col 0 on the next line instead of col max
 2022: %% on the current line.
 2023: %%
 2024: %% This caused problems when a string was `columns` long and then ended in "\r\n"
 2025: %% as it would first wrap due to " \b" and then output "\r\n" that cause a double
 2026: %% newline to happen.
 2027: %%
 2028: %% This testcase tests that we get a " \b" when we should and we get a "\r\n" when
 2029: %% we should.
 2030: wrap(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 2031:     case proplists:get_value(default_shell, Config) of
 2032:         new ->
 2033:             As = lists:duplicate(20,"a"),
 2034:             rtnode:run(
 2035:               [{putline, "io:columns()."},
 2036:                {expect, "{ok,20}\r\n"},
 2037:                {putline, ["io:format(\"~s\",[lists:duplicate(20,\"a\")])."]},
 2038:                {expect, As ++ " \b"},
 2039:                {putline, ["io:format(\"~s~n~s\",[lists:duplicate(20,\"a\"),lists:duplicate(20,\"a\")])."]},
 2040:                {expect, As ++ "\r\n" ++ As ++ " \b"}
 2041:               ],
 2042:               [],
 2043:               "stty rows 40; stty columns 20; ");
 2044:         _ ->
 2045:             ok
 2046:     end,
 2047:     ok.
 2048: 
 2049: %% This testcase tests that shell_history works as it should.
 2050: %% We use Ctrl + P = Cp=[$\^p] in order to navigate up
 2051: %% We use Ctrl + N = Cp=[$\^n] in order to navigate down
 2052: %% We use Ctrl + B = Cp=[$\^b] in order to navigate left
 2053: %% in the console. We also need to sleep for a while in order
 2054: %% for the system to update the display before we enter more
 2055: %% commands.
 2056: shell_history(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 2057:     Path = shell_history_path(Config, "basic"),
 2058:     rtnode:run(
 2059:       [{putline, "echo1."},
 2060:        {expect, "echo1\r\n"},
 2061:        {putline, "echo2."},
 2062:        {expect, "echo2\r\n"},
 2063:        {putline, "echo3."},
 2064:        {expect, "echo3\r\n"},
 2065:        {putline, "echo4."},
 2066:        {expect, "echo4\r\n"},
 2067:        {putline, "echo5."},
 2068:        {expect, "echo5\r\n"}
 2069:       ], [], [], mk_history_param(Path)),
 2070:     receive after 1000 -> ok end,
 2071:     rtnode:run(
 2072:       [{sleep,100},
 2073:        {putline, ""},
 2074:        %% the init:stop that stopped the node is dropped
 2075:        {putdata, [$\^p]}, {expect, "echo5[.]$"},
 2076:        {putdata, [$\n]},
 2077:        {expect, "echo5\r\n"},
 2078:        {putdata, [$\^p]}, {expect, "echo5[.]$"},
 2079:        {putdata, [$\^p]}, {expect, "echo4[.]$"},
 2080:        {putdata, [$\^p]}, {expect, "echo3[.]$"},
 2081:        {putdata, [$\^p]}, {expect, "echo2[.]$"},
 2082:        {putdata, [$\^n]}, {expect, "echo3[.]$"},
 2083:        {putdata, [$\^n]}, {expect, "echo4[.]$"},
 2084:        {putdata, [$\^b]}, {sleep,50}, %% the echo4. (cursor moved one left)
 2085:        {putline, ["ECHO"]},
 2086:        {expect, "echo4ECHO\r\n"}
 2087:       ], [], [],
 2088:       mk_history_param(Path)),
 2089:     receive after 1000 -> ok end,
 2090: 
 2091:     %% ignore input given after io:get_line, and after h(module) pager
 2092:     rtnode:run(
 2093:        [{putdata, "io:get_line(\"getline>\").\n"},
 2094:         {expect, "getline>"},
 2095:         {putline, "hej"}, {expect, "hej\r\n"},
 2096:         {putdata, [$\^p]}, {expect, "\\Qio:get_line(\"getline>\")\\E[.]$"}
 2097:        ], [], [],
 2098:        mk_history_param(Path)),
 2099:     ok.
 2100: 
 2101: shell_history_resize(Config) ->
 2102:     Path = shell_history_path(Config, "resize"),
 2103:     rtnode:run(
 2104:       [{putline, "echo."},
 2105:        {expect, "echo\r\n"},
 2106:        {putline, "echo2."},
 2107:        {expect, "echo2\r\n"}
 2108:       ], [], [], ["-kernel","shell_history_file_bytes","123456"] ++
 2109:           mk_history_param(Path)),
 2110: 
 2111:     {ok, Logs} =
 2112:         rtnode:run(
 2113:           [{sleep,100},
 2114:            {putline, ""},
 2115:            {putdata, [$\^p]}, {expect, "echo2[.]$$"},
 2116:            {putdata, [$\^p]}, {expect, "echo[.]$"},
 2117:            {putdata, [$\n]},
 2118:            {expect, "echo"}
 2119:           ], [], [], ["-kernel","shell_history_file_bytes","654321"] ++
 2120:               mk_history_param(Path)),
 2121: 
 2122:     rtnode:check_logs(
 2123:       "erlang.log.1",
 2124:       "The configured log history file size is different from the size "
 2125:       "of the log file on disk", Logs),
 2126: 
 2127:     ok.
 2128: 
 2129: shell_history_eaccess(Config) ->
 2130:     Path = shell_history_path(Config, "eaccess"),
 2131:     file:make_dir(filename:dirname(Path)),
 2132:     ok = file:make_dir(Path),
 2133:     {ok, Info} = file:read_file_info(Path),
 2134:     try
 2135:         NoExecMode = Info#file_info.mode band (bnot 8#111),
 2136:         file:write_file_info(Path,Info#file_info{ mode = NoExecMode }),
 2137: 
 2138:         %% Cannot create history log in folder
 2139:         {ok, Logs1} =
 2140:             rtnode:run(
 2141:               [{putline, "echo."},
 2142:                {expect, "echo\r\n"}
 2143:               ], [], [], mk_history_param(Path)),
 2144: 
 2145:         ct:pal("~p",[Logs1]),
 2146:         rtnode:check_logs("erlang.log.1", "Error handling file", Logs1),
 2147: 
 2148:         %% shell_docs recursively creates the folder to store the
 2149:         %% logs. This test checks that erlang still starts if we
 2150:         %% cannot create the folders to the path.
 2151:         {ok, Logs2} =
 2152:             rtnode:run(
 2153:               [{putline, "echo."},
 2154:                {expect, "echo\r\n"}
 2155:               ], [], [], mk_history_param(filename:join(Path,"logs"))),
 2156: 
 2157:         rtnode:check_logs("erlang.log.1", "Error handling file", Logs2)
 2158: 
 2159:     after
 2160:         file:write_file_info(Path, Info)
 2161:     end,
 2162:     ok.
 2163: 
 2164: shell_history_repair(Config) ->
 2165:     Path = shell_history_path(Config, "repair"),
 2166: 
 2167:     %% We stop a node without closing the log
 2168:     shell_history_halt(Path),
 2169: 
 2170:     {ok, Logs} =
 2171:         rtnode:run(
 2172:           [{putline, ""},
 2173:            {putdata, [$\^p]}, {expect, "echo[.]$"},
 2174:            {putdata, [$\n]},
 2175:            {expect, "echo\r\n"}
 2176:           ], [], [], mk_history_param(Path)),
 2177: 
 2178:     %% The regexp below checks that he string is NOT part of the log
 2179:     rtnode:check_logs("erlang.log.1",
 2180:                       "The shell history log file was corrupted and was repaired",
 2181:                       false,
 2182:                       Logs),
 2183:     ok.
 2184: 
 2185: shell_history_repair_corrupt(Config) ->
 2186:     Path = shell_history_path(Config, "repair_corrupt"),
 2187: 
 2188:     %% We stop a node without closing the log
 2189:     shell_history_halt(Path),
 2190: 
 2191:     %% We corrupt the disklog
 2192:     {ok, D} = file:open(filename:join(Path,"erlang-shell-log.1"), [read,append]),
 2193:     ok = file:write(D, [10,10]),
 2194:     ok = file:close(D),
 2195: 
 2196:     {ok, Logs} =
 2197:         rtnode:run(
 2198:           [{putline, ""},
 2199:            {putdata, [$\^p]}, {expect, "echo[.]$"},
 2200:            {putdata, [$\n]},
 2201:            {expect, "echo\r\n"}
 2202:           ], [], [], mk_history_param(Path)),
 2203: 
 2204:     rtnode:check_logs("erlang.log.1",
 2205:                       "The shell history log file was corrupted and was repaired.",
 2206:                       Logs),
 2207:     ok.
 2208: 
 2209: shell_history_corrupt(Config) ->
 2210:     Path = shell_history_path(Config, "corrupt"),
 2211: 
 2212:     %% We initialize the shell history log with a known value.
 2213:     rtnode:run(
 2214:       [{putline, "echo."},
 2215:        {expect, "echo\r\n"},
 2216:        {putline, "echo2."},
 2217:        {expect, "echo2\r\n"}
 2218:       ], [], [], mk_history_param(Path)),
 2219: 
 2220:     %% We corrupt the disklog.
 2221:     {ok, D} = file:open(filename:join(Path,"erlang-shell-log.1"), [read, append]),
 2222:     ok = file:write(D, [10, 10]),
 2223:     ok = file:close(D),
 2224: 
 2225:     {ok, Logs} =
 2226:         rtnode:run(
 2227:           [{putline, ""},
 2228:            {putdata, [$\^p]}, {expect, "echo2[.]$"},
 2229:            {putdata, [$\^p]}, {expect, "echo[.]$"},
 2230:            {putdata, [$\n]},
 2231:            {expect, "echo\r\n"}
 2232:           ], [], [], mk_history_param(Path)),
 2233: 
 2234:     rtnode:check_logs("erlang.log.1", "Invalid chunk in the file", Logs),
 2235:     ok.
 2236: 
 2237: %% Stop the node without closing the log.
 2238: shell_history_halt(Path) ->
 2239:     try
 2240:         rtnode:run(
 2241:           [{putline, "echo."},
 2242:            {expect, "echo\r\n"},
 2243:            {sleep, 2500}, % disk_log internal cache timer is 2000 ms
 2244:            {putline, "halt(0)."},
 2245:            {expect, "\r\n"},
 2246:            {sleep, 1000} %% wait for node to terminate
 2247:           ], [], [], mk_history_param(Path))
 2248:     catch
 2249:         _:_ ->
 2250:             ok
 2251:     end.
 2252: 
 2253: shell_history_path(Config, TestCase) ->
 2254:     filename:join([proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
 2255:                    "shell_history", TestCase]).
 2256: 
 2257: mk_history_param(Path) ->
 2258:     ["-kernel","shell_history","enabled",
 2259:      "-kernel","shell_history_path","\"" ++ Path ++ "\"",
 2260:      "-kernel","shell_history_drop","[\"init:stop().\"]"
 2261:     ].
 2262: 
 2263: shell_history_custom(_Config) ->
 2264:     %% Up key: Ctrl + P = Cp=[$\^p]
 2265:     rtnode:run(
 2266:       [{expect, "1> $"},
 2267:        %% {putline, ""},
 2268:        {putdata, [$\^p]}, {expect, "0[.]"},
 2269:        {putdata, [$\n]},
 2270:        {expect, "0\r\n"},
 2271:        {putline, "echo."},
 2272:        {expect, "!echo\r\n"} % exclamation mark is printed by custom history module
 2273:       ], [], [], ["-kernel","shell_history",atom_to_list(?MODULE),
 2274:                   "-pz",filename:dirname(code:which(?MODULE))]),
 2275:     ok.
 2276: 
 2277: shell_history_custom_errors(_Config) ->
 2278: 
 2279:     %% Check that we can start with a node with an undefined
 2280:     %% provider module.
 2281:     rtnode:run(
 2282:       [{putline, "echo."},
 2283:        {expect, "echo\r\n"}
 2284:       ], [], [], ["-kernel","shell_history","very_broken",
 2285:                   "-pz",filename:dirname(code:which(?MODULE))]),
 2286: 
 2287:     %% Check that we can start with a node with a provider module
 2288:     %% that crashes in load/0.
 2289:     rtnode:run(
 2290:       [{putline, "echo."},
 2291:        {expect, "echo\r\n"}
 2292:       ], [], [], ["-kernel","shell_history",atom_to_list(?MODULE),
 2293:                   "-kernel","provider_load","crash",
 2294:                   "-pz",filename:dirname(code:which(?MODULE))]),
 2295: 
 2296:     %% Check that we can start with a node with a provider module
 2297:     %% that return incorrect in load/0.
 2298:     rtnode:run(
 2299:       [{putline, "echo."},
 2300:        {expect, "echo\r\n"}
 2301:       ], [], [], ["-kernel","shell_history",atom_to_list(?MODULE),
 2302:                   "-kernel","provider_load","badreturn",
 2303:                   "-pz",filename:dirname(code:which(?MODULE))]),
 2304: 
 2305:     %% Check that we can start with a node with a provider module
 2306:     %% that crashes in load/0.
 2307:     rtnode:run(
 2308:       [{putline, "echo."},
 2309:        {expect, "(Disabling shell history logging.|echo)"},
 2310:        {expect, "(Disabling shell history logging.|echo)"}
 2311:       ], [], [], ["-kernel","shell_history",atom_to_list(?MODULE),
 2312:                   "-kernel","provider_add","crash",
 2313:                   "-pz",filename:dirname(code:which(?MODULE))]),
 2314: 
 2315:     %% Check that we can start with a node with a provider module
 2316:     %% that return incorrect in load/0.
 2317:     rtnode:run(
 2318:       [{putline, "echo."},
 2319:        {expect, "It returned {error,badreturn}.\r\n"},
 2320:        {expect, "echo\r\n"}
 2321:       ], [], [], ["-kernel","shell_history",atom_to_list(?MODULE),
 2322:                   "-kernel","provider_add","badreturn",
 2323:                   "-pz",filename:dirname(code:which(?MODULE))]),
 2324: 
 2325:     ok.
 2326: 
 2327: load() ->
 2328:     case application:get_env(kernel,provider_load) of
 2329:         {ok, crash} ->
 2330:             error(crash);
 2331:         {ok, badreturn} ->
 2332:             %% Should return a list of string()
 2333:             ok;
 2334:         _ ->
 2335:             ["0.\n\n"]
 2336:     end.
 2337: 
 2338: add(_Line) ->
 2339:     case application:get_env(kernel,provider_add) of
 2340:         {ok, crash} ->
 2341:             error(crash);
 2342:         {ok, badreturn} ->
 2343:             %% Should return ok
 2344:             {error, badreturn};
 2345:         _ ->
 2346:             io:format("!", [])
 2347:     end.
 2348: 
 2349: %% Tests that local shell can be started by means of job control.
 2350: job_control_local(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 2351:     case proplists:get_value(default_shell, Config) of
 2352: 	old ->
 2353: 	    %% Old shell tests
 2354: 	    {skip,"No new shell found"};
 2355: 	new ->
 2356: 	    %% New shell tests
 2357: 	    rtnode:run(
 2358:               [{putline, ""},
 2359:                {expect,  "1> $"},
 2360:                {putline, "2."},
 2361:                {expect,  "\r\n2\r\n"},
 2362:                {putline, "\^g"},
 2363:                {expect,  "--> $"},
 2364:                {putline, "s"},
 2365:                {expect,  "--> $"},
 2366:                {putline, "c"},
 2367:                {expect,  "\r\nEshell"},
 2368:                {expect,  "1> $"},
 2369:                {putline, "35."},
 2370:                {expect,  "\r\n35\r\n"},
 2371:                {expect,  "2> $"},
 2372:                {putline, "receive M -> M end.\r\n"},
 2373:                {putline, "\^g"},
 2374:                {expect,  "--> $"},
 2375:                {putline, "i 3"},
 2376:                {expect,  "Unknown job"},
 2377:                {expect,  "--> $"},
 2378:                {putline, "i 2"},
 2379:                {expect,  "--> $"},
 2380:                {putline, "c"},
 2381:                {expect,  "[*][*] exception exit: killed"},
 2382:                {expect,  "[23]>"},
 2383:                {putline, "\^g"},
 2384:                {expect,  "--> $"},
 2385:                {putline, "k 3"},
 2386:                {expect,  "Unknown job"},
 2387:                {expect,  "--> $"},
 2388:                {putline, "k 2"},
 2389:                {expect,  "--> $"},
 2390:                {putline, "k"},
 2391:                {expect,  "Unknown job"},
 2392:                {expect,  "--> $"},
 2393:                {putline, "c"},
 2394:                {expect,  "Unknown job"},
 2395:                {expect,  "--> $"},
 2396:                {putline, "i"},
 2397:                {expect,  "Unknown job"},
 2398:                {expect,  "--> $"},
 2399:                {putline, "?"},
 2400:                {expect,  "this message"},
 2401:                {expect,  "--> $"},
 2402:                {putline, "h"},
 2403:                {expect,  "this message"},
 2404:                {expect,  "--> $"},
 2405:                {putline, "c 1"},
 2406:                {expect, "\r\n"},
 2407:                {putline, "35."},
 2408:                {expect, "\r\n35\r\n"},
 2409:                {expect, "[23]> $"}
 2410:               ]),
 2411:             ok
 2412:     end.
 2413: 
 2414: %% Tests that remote shell can be started by means of job control.
 2415: job_control_remote(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 2416:     case proplists:get_value(default_shell, Config) of
 2417: 	old ->
 2418: 	    {skip,"No new shell found"};
 2419: 	_ ->
 2420:             {ok, Peer, NSNode} = ?CT_PEER(#{ args => ["-connect_all","false"],
 2421:                                              peer_down => continue }),
 2422:             try
 2423:                 test_remote_job_control(NSNode)
 2424:             after
 2425:                 peer:stop(Peer)
 2426:             end
 2427:     end.
 2428: 
 2429: %% Tests that remote shell can be started by means of job control to
 2430: %% -noshell node.
 2431: job_control_remote_noshell(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 2432:     case proplists:get_value(default_shell, Config) of
 2433: 	old ->
 2434: 	    {skip,"No new shell found"};
 2435: 	_ ->
 2436: 	    {ok, Peer, NSNode} = ?CT_PEER(#{ name => peer:random_name(test_remote_job_control),
 2437:                                              args => ["-connect_all","false","-noshell"],
 2438:                                              peer_down => continue }),
 2439:             try
 2440:                 test_remote_job_control(NSNode)
 2441:             after
 2442:                 peer:stop(Peer)
 2443:             end
 2444:     end.
 2445: 
 2446: test_remote_job_control(Node) ->
 2447:     RemNode = peer:random_name(test_remote_job_control),
 2448:     Pid = spawn_link(Node, fun() ->
 2449:                                    receive die ->
 2450:                                            ok
 2451:                                    end
 2452:                            end),
 2453:     PidStr = erpc:call(Node, erlang, pid_to_list, [Pid]),
 2454:     true = erpc:call(Node, erlang, register, [kalaskula,Pid]),
 2455:     PrintedNode = printed_atom(Node),
 2456:     CookieString = printed_atom(erlang:get_cookie()),
 2457: 
 2458:     rtnode:run(
 2459:       [{putline, ""},
 2460:        {putline, "erlang:get_cookie()."},
 2461:        {expect, "\r\n\\Q" ++ CookieString ++ "\\E"},
 2462:        {putdata, "\^g"},
 2463:        {expect, " --> $"},
 2464:        {putline, "r " ++ PrintedNode},
 2465:        {expect, "\r\n"},
 2466:        {putline, "j"},
 2467:        {expect, "1  {shell,start,\\[init]}"},
 2468:        {expect, "2[*] {\\Q"++PrintedNode++"\\E,shell,start,\\[]}"},
 2469:        {expect, " --> $"},
 2470:        {putline, "c"},
 2471:        {expect, "\r\n"},
 2472:        {expect, "Eshell"},
 2473:        {expect, "\\Q(" ++ atom_to_list(Node) ++")1> \\E$"},
 2474:        {putline, "whereis(kalaskula)."},
 2475:        {expect, PidStr},
 2476:        {putline, "kalaskula ! die."},
 2477:        {putline, "exit()."},
 2478:        {expect, "[*][*][*] Shell process terminated!"},
 2479:        {putdata, "\^g"},
 2480:        {expect, " --> $"},
 2481:        {putline, "j"},
 2482:        {expect, "1  {shell,start,\\[init]}"},
 2483:        {expect, " --> $"},
 2484:        {putline, "c"},
 2485:        {expect, "Unknown job"},
 2486:        {expect, " --> $"},
 2487:        {putline, "c 1"},
 2488:        {expect, "\\Q("++RemNode++"@\\E[^)]*\\)[12]> $"},
 2489:        {putdata, "\^g"},
 2490:        {expect, " --> $"},
 2491:        {putline, "j"},
 2492:        {expect, "1[*] {shell,start,\\[init]}"},
 2493:        {putline, "c"},
 2494:        {expect, "\\Q("++RemNode++"@\\E[^)]*\\)[123]> $"},
 2495:        {sleep, 100},
 2496:        {putline, "35."},
 2497:        {expect, "\\Q("++RemNode++"@\\E[^)]*\\)[123]> $"}
 2498:       ], RemNode),
 2499:     Pid ! die,
 2500:     ok.
 2501: 
 2502: %% Tests various control keys.
 2503: ctrl_keys(_Config) ->
 2504:     Cu = [$\^u],
 2505:     Cw = [$\^w],
 2506:     Cy = [$\^y],
 2507:     Home = [27,$O,$H],
 2508:     End = [27,$O,$F],
 2509:     rtnode:run(
 2510:       [{putline,""},
 2511:        {putline,"2."},
 2512:        {expect,"2"},
 2513:        {putline,"\"hello "++Cw++"world\"."},	% test <CTRL>+W
 2514:        {expect,"\"world\""},
 2515:        {putline,"\"hello "++Cu++"\"world\"."},	% test <CTRL>+U
 2516:        {expect,"\"world\""},
 2517:        {putline,"world\"."++Home++"\"hello "},	% test <HOME>
 2518:        {expect,"\"hello world\""},
 2519:        {putline,"world"++Home++"\"hello "++End++"\"."},	% test <END>
 2520:        {expect,"\"hello world\""},
 2521:        {putline,"\"hello world\""++Cu++Cy++"."},
 2522:        {expect,"\"hello world\""}] ++
 2523:           wordLeft() ++ wordRight()),
 2524:     ok.
 2525: 
 2526: wordLeft() ->
 2527:     L1 = "\e\e[D",
 2528:     L2 = "\e[5D",
 2529:     L3 = "\e[1;5D",
 2530:     wordLeft(L1) ++ wordLeft(L2) ++ wordLeft(L3).
 2531: 
 2532: wordLeft(Chars) ->
 2533:     End = "\eOF",
 2534:     [{putline,"\"world\""++Chars++"hello "++End++"."},
 2535:      {expect,"\"hello world\""}].
 2536: 
 2537: wordRight() ->
 2538:     R1 = "\e\e[C",
 2539:     R2 = "\e[5C",
 2540:     R3 = "\e[1;5C",
 2541:     wordRight(R1) ++ wordRight(R2) ++ wordRight(R3).
 2542: 
 2543: wordRight(Chars) ->
 2544:     Home = "\eOH",
 2545:     [{putline,"world"++Home++"\"hello "++Chars++"\"."},
 2546:      {expect,"\"hello world\""}].
 2547: 
 2548: %% Test that -remsh works
 2549: remsh_basic(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 2550:     {ok, Peer, TargetNode} = ?CT_PEER(),
 2551:     TargetNodeStr = printed_atom(TargetNode),
 2552:     [_Name,Host] = string:split(atom_to_list(node()), "@"),
 2553: 
 2554:     PreCmds = [{putline,""},
 2555:                {putline,"node()."},
 2556:                {expect, "\\Q" ++ TargetNodeStr ++ "\\E\r\n"}],
 2557: 
 2558:     PostCmds = quit_hosting_node(),
 2559: 
 2560:     %% Test that remsh works with explicit -sname.
 2561:     HostNode = atom_to_list(?FUNCTION_NAME) ++ "_host",
 2562:     HostNodeStr = printed_atom(list_to_atom(HostNode ++ "@" ++ Host)),
 2563:     rtnode:run(
 2564:       PreCmds ++
 2565:           [{putline,"nodes()."},
 2566:            {expect, "\\Q" ++ HostNodeStr ++ "\\E"}] ++
 2567:           PostCmds,
 2568:       HostNode, " ", "-remsh " ++ TargetNodeStr),
 2569: 
 2570:     %% Test that remsh works without -sname.
 2571:     rtnode:run(PreCmds ++ PostCmds, [], " ", "-remsh " ++ TargetNodeStr),
 2572: 
 2573:     %% Test that if multiple remsh are given, we select the first
 2574:     rtnode:run([{expect, "Multiple"}] ++ PreCmds ++ PostCmds,
 2575:                [], " ",
 2576:                "-remsh " ++ TargetNodeStr ++ " -remsh invalid_node"),
 2577: 
 2578:     peer:stop(Peer),
 2579: 
 2580:     ok.
 2581: 
 2582: %% Test that if we cannot connect to a node, we get a correct error
 2583: remsh_error(_Config) ->
 2584:     "Could not connect to \"invalid_node\"\n" =
 2585:         os:cmd(ct:get_progname() ++ " -remsh invalid_node").
 2586: 
 2587: quit_hosting_node() ->
 2588:     %% Command sequence for entering a shell on the hosting node.
 2589:     [{putdata, "\^g"},
 2590:      {expect, "--> $"},
 2591:      {putline, "s"},
 2592:      {expect, "--> $"},
 2593:      {putline, "c"},
 2594:      {expect, ["Eshell"]},
 2595:      {expect, ["1> $"]}].
 2596: 
 2597: %% Test that -remsh works with long names.
 2598: remsh_longnames(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 2599:     %% If we cannot resolve the domain, we need to add localhost to the longname
 2600:     Domain =
 2601:         case inet_db:res_option(domain) of
 2602:             [] ->
 2603:                 "@127.0.0.1";
 2604:             _ -> ""
 2605:         end,
 2606:     Name = peer:random_name(?FUNCTION_NAME),
 2607:     case rtnode:start(" -name " ++ Name ++ Domain) of
 2608:         {ok, _SRPid, STPid, SNode, SState} ->
 2609:             try
 2610:                 {ok, _CRPid, CTPid, CNode, CState} =
 2611:                     rtnode:start("-name undefined" ++ Domain ++
 2612:                                      " -remsh " ++ Name),
 2613:                 try
 2614:                     ok = rtnode:send_commands(
 2615:                            SNode,
 2616:                            STPid,
 2617:                            [{putline, ""},
 2618:                             {putline, "node()."},
 2619:                             {expect, "\\Q" ++ Name ++ "\\E"}], 1),
 2620:                     ok = rtnode:send_commands(
 2621:                            CNode,
 2622:                            CTPid,
 2623:                            [{putline, ""},
 2624:                             {putline, "node()."},
 2625:                             {expect, "\\Q" ++ Name ++ "\\E"} | quit_hosting_node()], 1)
 2626:                 after
 2627:                     rtnode:dump_logs(rtnode:stop(CState))
 2628:                 end
 2629:             after
 2630:                 rtnode:dump_logs(rtnode:stop(SState))
 2631:             end;
 2632:         {skip, _} = Else ->
 2633:             Else
 2634:     end.
 2635: 
 2636: %% Test that -remsh works without epmd.
 2637: remsh_no_epmd(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 2638:     EPMD_ARGS = "-start_epmd false -erl_epmd_port 12346 ",
 2639:     Name = ?CT_PEER_NAME(),
 2640:     case rtnode:start([],"ERL_EPMD_PORT=12345 ",
 2641:                       EPMD_ARGS ++ " -sname " ++ Name) of
 2642:         {ok, _SRPid, STPid, SNode, SState} ->
 2643:             try
 2644:                 ok = rtnode:send_commands(
 2645:                        SNode,
 2646:                        STPid,
 2647:                        [{putline, ""},
 2648:                         {putline, "node()."},
 2649:                         {expect, "\\Q" ++ Name ++ "\\E"}], 1),
 2650:                 {ok, _CRPid, CTPid, CNode, CState} =
 2651:                     rtnode:start([],"ERL_EPMD_PORT=12345 ",
 2652:                                  EPMD_ARGS ++ " -remsh "++Name),
 2653:                 try
 2654:                     ok = rtnode:send_commands(
 2655:                            CNode,
 2656:                            CTPid,
 2657:                            [{putline, ""},
 2658:                             {putline, "node()."},
 2659:                             {expect, "\\Q" ++ Name ++ "\\E"} | quit_hosting_node()], 1)
 2660:                 after
 2661:                     rtnode:dump_logs(rtnode:stop(CState))
 2662:                 end
 2663:             after
 2664:                 rtnode:dump_logs(rtnode:stop(SState))
 2665:             end;
 2666:         {skip, _} = Else ->
 2667:             Else
 2668:     end.
 2669: remsh_expand_compatibility_25(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 2670:     {ok, _Peer, TargetNode} = ?CT_PEER(#{}), %% Create a vsn 26 node
 2671:     NodeName = atom_to_list(TargetNode), %% compatibility
 2672:     %% Start a node on vsn 25 but run the shell on vsn 26
 2673:     case rtnode:start(peer:random_name(), "stty columns 200; ERL_AFLAGS= ", "-remsh "++NodeName, [{release, "25"}|Config]) of
 2674:         {ok, _SRPid, STPid, _, SState} ->
 2675:             try
 2676:                 ok = rtnode:send_commands(undefined,
 2677:                        STPid,
 2678:                        [{putdata, "erlang:is_atom\t"},
 2679:                         {expect, "\\Qerlang:is_atom(\\E"}|
 2680:                         quit_hosting_node()], 1)
 2681:             after
 2682:                 Logs = rtnode:stop(SState),
 2683:                 rtnode:dump_logs(Logs)
 2684:             end;
 2685:         Else when element(1, Else) =/= ok -> Else
 2686:     end.
 2687: remsh_expand_compatibility_later_version(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 2688:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
 2689:     case ?CT_PEER_REL([], "25", PrivDir) of
 2690:         not_available -> {skip, "25 not available"};
 2691:         {ok, _Peer, TargetNode}  ->
 2692:             NodeName = atom_to_list(TargetNode),
 2693:             %% Start a node on later version but run the shell on vsn 25
 2694:             case rtnode:start(peer:random_name(), "stty columns 200; ERL_AFLAGS= ", "-remsh " ++ NodeName, Config) of
 2695:                 {ok, _SRPid, STPid, _, SState} ->
 2696:                     try
 2697:                         ok = rtnode:send_commands(undefined,
 2698:                             STPid,
 2699:                             [{putdata, "erlang:is_atom\t"},
 2700:                              {expect, "\\Qerlang:is_atom(\\E"}|
 2701:                              quit_hosting_node()], 1)
 2702:                     after
 2703:                         Logs = rtnode:stop(SState),
 2704:                         rtnode:dump_logs(Logs)
 2705:                     end;
 2706:                 Else when element(1, Else) =/= ok -> Else
 2707:             end
 2708:     end.
 2709: 
 2710: printed_atom(A) ->
 2711:     lists:flatten(io_lib:format("~w", [A])).
